RoomType: Suite CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
Quite simply, a fantastic experience at what must be one of the best hotels in Danang. The hotel feels very new, and the quality of everything is there to be seen...from furnishings and fixtures to the quality of the bathroom & shower areas. Our room was outstanding, could not fault anything about it, and the view is unbeatable, looking straight out over the ocean. A small thing, but another big tick, even the in-room fridge was set nice and cold...sometimes the small fridges are not cold enough, with no way to amend the setting, but these were bang on.
As with all our Vietnam hotel stays (this was our 5th in 2 weeks) the staff go out of their way to make you feel special and welcomed to the hotel. (Special mention to young Ferb on Reception) The breakfast offering was top notch, well worth a visit even if not staying at the hotel. The pool area is also very nice, with an infinity view out to sea and plenty areas for the kids to play, as well as having an in-pool bar for the grown ups. Genuinely, full of praise for the Awaken, we had only booked 1 night as part of our trip home, but I wish we'd been able to extend it longer.
Negative_Review: Could not fault a thing, it was just a shame the hotel was not busier, as it certainly deserves to be. Once high season kicks in, I'm sure it'll be full regularly.
Review_Title: Fantastic hotel, 5 star quality, highly recommended.

Positive_Review: Beautiful view(ocean view- Suite). Comfortable beds. Cold pool- very refreshing at hot days.
Negative_Review: There was a firealarm running from 10am to 5pm. We were not informed prior to the alarm and had to take the stairs from the 20 th floor. Elevators were nevertheless running and were stopped when the Alarm went on- also without any kind of Information so that you were stucked. We got a â€giftâ€œ from the Manager which was a fruit plate. Most of the staff couldnt speak good english. You can get the View in every other Hotel at that Beach!

RoomType: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i cÃ³ Ban cÃ´ng vÃ  NhÃ¬n ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: Hotel is in great location, new and modern. Sea view is wonderful, administration staff very polite and friendly.
Negative_Review:
The biggest things I didn't like is constant control of my movement.
Administration staff is wonderful and polite but hotel management should improve a lot:
1. Once you take an umbrella because it rains you need so sign a contract, once you give the umbrella back you need to write your signature (!).
2. Every bill you pay, you should sign with signature, why you should still do that in 2024?
3. We ordered a breakfast for 1 additional person day before and hotel staff called us 21:30 PM once we were already sleeping to ask how we would pay - at the buffet or during checkout. It was nonsense to ask such a question once we asked by ourselves day before that we would need additional breakfast and will pay an extra for that...
4. During the checkout we were asked to wait while our room will be checked, we waited 20 minutes and went to the parking garage, then we were stopped to wait again and later staff apologised for all that once they checked our room.
5. Second night there were some construction noise in one of the floors.

The hotel staff forced us to feel like we are some criminals but we didn't do anything wrong and didn't have any intentions, I have visited many 5 stars hotels but this one lacked a lot of professionalism and should improve if they want to keep its status.
Review_Title: Great location with wonderful sea view but terrible hotel management

Positive_Review:
Wow, what a hotel! Probably one of the most iconic rooms we stayed in for a while. The hotel is located on the city side of Da nang, not the beach strip so beware of that. The hotel is brand new, they have the most incredible gym weâ€™ve seen all across Vietnam, all with newest Technogym machines. We tried massages at the spa and that was also a fantastic experience.

The room is extremely comfortable and super beautifully designed. The staff are super attentive and lunch/dinner at the hotel are also great.
Negative_Review: My only point would be maybe having a bit more European food at breakfast, but otherwise it was a 10/10 either way.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Premium CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King, Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng VÃ  Bá»“n Táº¯m - Minibar Miá»…n PhÃ­
Positive_Review:
This is a new hotel, opened like a year ago. All facilities are top notch: lovely room, modern, everything perfect. Very friendly and helpful staff. The gym was the best I ever had in a hotel and even better than most official gyms! Great view from the room and no outside noise. Location pretty close to the city centre. Free minibar is a nice extra. good choice in breakfast. Great value for money!

9 out of 10

10 = I want to live here
9= I don't want to leave
8= Would love to come back
7= It was ok
6= just enough
5 or less = I regret staying here.
Negative_Review:
Minor things: 

- Gym is state of the art, but it doesn't look like the AC is adapted to the room. During cardio I sweated like a pig after only 15 min.
- Pool is a bit small and with a dull view.
- I was informed there were constructions going on on the top floor from 10 am, but it started at 8 am. I have understanding for this inconvenience, but please inform your guests correct.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Premium CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King, Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra SÃ´ng VÃ  Bá»“n Táº¯m - Quyá»n Sá»­ Dá»¥ng Club Lounge
Positive_Review:
First, the location, hotel is in city center and near Han river. So you can easily get a grab to restaurants nearby, as well as to My Khe beach all within less than 10 mins away. The surround quiet unlike hotels near the beach area.

Next, in terms of comfort, the room I stayed is King Club room which is in the 25 storey. Great views from the room especially at night, can see the glittering lights coming off buildings and the bridges. The room smells good, bed is comfortable, toilet and showering areas are separated with 2 basins for washing up.

Breakfast is not fantastic, but having it on the 24 floor club lounge provides good views. But the cocktails session from 5.30pm onwards food tray and drinks are nice. If you want a good breakfast, try the Eco bar at My Khe beach. They serve local Vietnamese and Western breakfast. Sit by the beach to enjoy the breakfast, views and sounds of the waves are amazing.

Staff service is fantastic. At check in, I was greeted well, provided early check in, and was walked to my room and briefed by the staff about the amenities I would enjoy.
Negative_Review: Breakfast is not delicious, I would eat somewhere else.
Review_Title: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel, from the friendly and attentive staff, to the hotel comfort.

Positive_Review: Absolutely stunning hotel in an amazing location. The staff were very friendly and catered to our needs. The views from the pool and room were stunning! Reasonably priced and they even do some laundry for you free of charge.
Negative_Review: There weren't very many sun beds by the pool but we typically didn't have to wait very long for them. The laundry service is free for 5 individual items of clothing but after that it's very expensive and you're better off going around the corner to one of the local laundry services. They did slightly shrink one linen shirt but everything else came back ok.

RoomType: Suite Premier GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: The guest relationship officers were excellent. Our room was facing the beach. There's an open-air nightclub/disco about 150 meters down the road. They were blasting their music late into the night which disturbed our sleep. The next morning, the GRO asked us whether we had a good sleep. My wife casually mentioned it's noisy and couldn't sleep. The GRO immediately took action and offered to change our room to a higher floor which we happily accepted. We had a good sleep after that. Next morning another GRO came looking for us while we were having breakfast. It was a pleasant surprise. She asked how was our sleep after we changed room. We told her we had a good sleep. The same thing happened when we checked out. Another GRO asked us the same question and hoped we had a good stay. We happily said yes. We're super happy with the excellent services of your GROs. They made us feel at home. Keep up the good services.

Positive_Review: I donâ€™t give top marks very often but this place was great. The area was excellent with the beach on one side and the little streets of Au Duong at the back. The room was huge and had no noise from neighboring rooms at all. Staff were, as is always the case in Vietnam, excellent. We were on the 22nd floor and did get a bit of street noise but didnâ€™t bother us too much at all and Iâ€™m very sensitive to noise. Lower floors might get a bit more. Breakfast wasnâ€™t included in our booking but it looked good. We just went to a little French bakery for a croissant (excellent) and coffee. Suited us to have a break from the big breakfasts weâ€™ve been having.

RoomType: Suite Premier GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Cáº£nh ThÃ nh Phá»‘
Positive_Review:
I loved this place - will come back here! I booked 20 nights in the TMS hotel and I loved everyone of them.

It starts with a very warm welcome where you're greeted with a friendly smile, a refreshing cocktail and a Hawaiian like flower necklace. When they asked me if they could take my photo I was a bit hesitant, but when they gave me the printed photo in a lovely welcome frame I was sold.

My room was as hoped. Large, huge bed, huge bathroom with super nice walk-in shower with a big rain shower-head. I had booked a room with city view and that's what I got. I stayed at the 23rd floor and the views were fantastic, I had a nice balcony with seating options and it was simply perfect. What I also loved is the AC which was very sensitive, but in a good way. You could really fine tune the room temp by changing it only 1'C degree up or down.

My room was also very quiet and when the sliding door the balcony is closed you shut out 99% of the outside noises.

I didn't spend much time on the rooftop even though it is a lovely terrace with a good restaurant (I ate here once). The rooftop infinity pool is very relaxed, but it only offers a few beach beds so if you want to spend some time there you have to be early. I couldn't care less as right in front of the hotel there's a long-stretched white sandy beach where you can enjoy the sun and sea in a perfect way. For only EUR 1,35 you can rent a bed for the day and get some refreshments too. The beach wasn't crowded when I stayed there and there's a lot of space if you want to have some more space. But again, this beach is plenty big and you will never feel crowded.

What else? Well to my opinion the most important was the genuine feel of the hospitality in TMS hotel. Each and every team member was fantastic and incredibly service oriented and friendly. A big shout out and THANK YOU to Thanh ThÃ o working in the small coffee corner in the lobby.
Review_Title: I Loved every minute of my stay

Positive_Review:
We had such a great time here!! The hotel is splendid but what makes it a really great hotel is the staff. 
They are helpful, kind, hospitable,...I cannot highlight them enough!
The restaurant is top-notch (price/quality is very, very good) and the restaurant staff is super professional and so kind. Chef Hung is a really good cook. (There wasn't a single dish we did not enjoy. Bur for me the ribs were chef's kiss. The meat fell of the bone.)
I also did a few treatments at the wellness which were wonderful. Trang Anh and her colleagues are excellent masseuses and the welcome you get is so kind and relaxing. 
The staff at the front desk (shout out to duty manager Jason who was super friendly and very funny), as well as all the other people working at the hotel, deserve praise. Not a single one did not greet you or was unkind. And whatever question you have, they are always there to help you with a smile.
The rooms are spacious and very clean. Big thumbs up for the cleaning crew!
We absolutely loved it here. Cannot recommend this hotel enough.

The location is amazing. Beachfront location with a rooftop infinity pool.
Negative_Review: The customer service from some of the staff was amazing from some staff members and in some case very lacking. I would want the brought to the attention of the hotel manager. I can cite a specific issue. I contact the front desk about the electric golf carts that take guests on sightseeing tours and we were told that we do not need to book in advance because the carts will come within 5 minutes as soon as we request one. So we said we would be down right away to request a sightseeing tour. We proceeded to go downstairs within 5 minutes of the phone call to the front desk in order to request the sightseeing tour but than we were told that the electric carts were on a break for 1 hour. Additionally we asked who we spoke with at the front desk to find out why we were told incomplete information and no one was able to say who we spoke with. I think that the Concierge/ front desk staff could use some training when it comes to local tours and attractions. and if they do not know any information they should be able to put us on hold to research for us.

RoomType: Suite Grand 2 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§ NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: Our oceanview room on the 23rd floor was modern, spacious, clean and had a fantastic view of the Da Nang beach coastline. Nice rooftop bar and pool. Location was excellent, just across the street from the very nice Bac My An beach. This was one of the nicest, cleanest public access beaches that I have visited compared Phuket, Hua Hin, Bali and Sentosa. There were also bars and restaurants within walking distance and attractions such as Dragon Bridge and Marble Mountains were just about 15mins by a short taxi/Grab ride. Also, liked that this areas is slightly quieter than the beach area further up north where the restaurants and hotels are more densely packed.
Negative_Review: Location near beach bars meant that we could hear the music from our room, but these were promptly turned off at 11pm each night and didn't disturb our sleep. Breakfast selection was average; during breakfast peak hours, it could get a bit crowded due to tour groups but it remained a pleasant dining experience.
Review_Title: Overall, an excellent hotel and we would definitely consider TMS hotel Da Nang again.

Positive_Review: We had a partial sea view room which was great, you could see the beach and sea so it was great. The room was very large and the air con was excellent, very comfortable bed, we slept really well, Wi-Fi was good no issues at all, the shower was amazing didnâ€™t want to get out. Huy Hoang was absolutely brilliant, his English was brilliant and he was really funny, he made our stay great. Thank you (Tom) which is what he called himself, the hotel could do with at least another 5 of him. Breakfast was ok, plenty of it but a bit of a bun fight in the mornings. Rooftop pool was amazing, fabulous views up and down the full length of beaches and happy hour with the cocktails and food was delightful. Fantastic hotel. Would definitely stay again and would highly recommend.
Negative_Review: A little noisy from the street at night as there are obviously beach parties and a lot of partying Koreans until early hours, this didnâ€™t affect us much as we were always tired enough to sleep after full days exploring so not much of an issue for us, but if you donâ€™t like the noise Iâ€™d suggest earplugs. That said itâ€™s not massively loud.
Review_Title: Fantastic hotel, fabulous staff and a rooftop pool view to die for

RoomType: Suite Premier 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
Overall the hotel was fantastic with lovely, airy, clean rooms with amazing balconies overlooking the beach and sea. The rooftop pool is just stunning and the top floor restaurant also has great food with amazing views over the city, particularly at night. The staff were great and very helpful in helping us organise trips to Hue and SunWorld for our daughter's birthday (highly recommend for a fun afternoon/evening)

Breakfast is great in the hotel, but there are plenty of other options nearby too if you want to get out and about. Our girls loved Crazy Cow ice cream and we also visited the Dragon Bridge on the Saturday night. Be prepared though as it was very busy on all the surrounding streets, so if you don't like crowds, you'll have to see the fire-breathing from a distance !!
Negative_Review:
This is isn't a criticism of the hotel, but be aware there is a lot of development going on in Da Nang and lots of construction site. On one of the days there was a lot of drilling and banging coming from a nearby site and there is a stage on the beach directly below the hotel that plays loud music most night until 11pm. 

Also be prepared for noise form the street outside (tooting of horns, etc) and also the fact the beach is packed at 5.30am with people watching the sunrise. None of these things can be controlled by the hotel though and they didn't detract from our stay. In short, if you want peace and quiet Da Nang is probably not the place for you....

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Room with ocean view
Negative_Review:
My experience with Four Points by Sheraton is generally good (fast check-in process; friendly and dedicated room service and bar staff). However, during my last morning at the hotel, there were issues at the buffet breakfast restaurant (level 3) that made my experience incompleted:
1. As I couldn't eat much and didn't want to waste food, I only took a small amount, just enough to eat. After putting my food on the table, I went to get water and when I came back all my food had been thrown away by the staff. I feel uncomfortable with this behavior. The staff should have asked my opinion before throwing all the food away like that. Furthermore, I feel that the staff works like a machine, only focusing on clearing the table without being tactful, not paying attention to customers and wasting food unnecessarily.
2. At the beverage counter, there are several types of vegetable and fruit juices. I saw watermelon juice but there was only about half a glass left. I asked the staff if I could have watermelon juice? The staff replied that that was it, watermelon juice was only for private room. Because they still have leftovers, they leave them here for other guests. I asked the staff that I had seen watermelon juice served in previous sessions to all guests and they said it was watermelon juice mixed with other juices, not pure watermelon??? It's funny that watermelon, a fruit that is so popular, low cost, and very common in every hotel restaurant, is a rarity at a hotel like Four Points. Besides, the staff's response made customers feel unappreciated and feel like a kind of secondary guests. I will consider whether I should return to Four Points for my next vacation.
3. And finally, I would like to privately feedback the above to Four Points but cannot find a channel to contact (email, phone or QR code...). I went to the website to find a contact but couldn't find it. So, via Booking.com's survey, hope the hotel can read it.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Right across from the beach, nice staff, lots of services and useful facilities on site. A swim in the rooftop pool was a great way to start the day.
Negative_Review: For the star rating and price of the hotel, I felt like certain things were a little basic, such as the quality of the toiletries. Also, I went to use the sauna / whirlpool room about an hour after it had officially opened, and the steam room and sauna hadn't been turned on yet. None of these are huge complaints - I just thought it would all feel a little more luxurious.
Review_Title: Useful if you want to be right at the beach, but value for money is a little questionable

The hotel also have incredible ocean views and we could see the lady Buddha statue from our room.
Negative_Review: The lift sounds were too high and we could hear â€˜ding dingsâ€™ the whole night with people going in and out of the hotel at all times. This really disturbed our sleep. At peak time 6 - 10am the lifts would be so busy and crowded that it takes you around 15 mins to get to the breakfast buffet. There were no chairs in the balcony for us to sit down and enjoy the views. The bathroom needed a good clean to get rid of stains, mould and dirt in the grouts. It was really disgusting to look at the shower tiles and bathroom sink. There was a foul smell in the lobby and hallways at all time which was really unpleasant.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng CÃ³ 1 GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King NhÃ¬n Ra ToÃ n Cáº£nh Biá»ƒn, Táº§ng Cao, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review:
1. Great rooftop pool
2. The breakfast buffet was good
3. Clean room and service from room attendants was fast and efficient.
4. If you don't spend too much time in the room and are mostly out doing activities then this place is fine. 
If you plan on staying in and lazing around then it could become cramped. 

5. The sauna and spa- seperate one for Males and Females. Sauna fits 2/3 adults. It's tiny BUT the view is of the city floor to ceiling glass- quite awesome.
Both sauna and spa are old and need a little fixing up. 

6. High tea- great selection of little treats. Loved it.
Negative_Review:
1. Rooms are too small and cramped. I was on level 31. 
2. Toilet didn't work and needed the plumber to come by to fix it
3. Bathroom- there were old grout stains and felt worn and dates
4. Had some booking issues with the front desk girl trying to explain to me the extra room charges. Took me 5 attempts to explain it to her. 
She wanted to charge me -extra person fee, room surcharge fee .... It didn't make sense at all. 
Took her 30 min before calling the manager to solve it in 2 minutes. 
Tara- manager on duty. She's the best. 

5. Movie night- they played the wrong movie for my 8 and 10 yo to watch. We watched the movie anyway because it was another cartoon. Comfy bean bags for you to sit on. 
6. As soon as you walk into the lobby area there is a distinct smell..... Disinfectant/smelly socks/toilet smell (this is what my kids called it) but there is an odor of some sort. Could be the De Nang smell, not sure.
Review_Title: It does the job for a young family of 4

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review:
Wonderful breakfast, very nice hotel and amenities. Used the pool and sauna. 
Right across the street from the beach.
Negative_Review:
It would be very nice to have something to sit or lay down in the sauna area. It is a bit funny to have to sit on the stairs between two rounds of sauna. 

The communication flows in the hotel have severe room to improve. 
My partner got stuck in an elevator with 9 people. They rang the bell and asked for help. They heard someone but nothing seemed to happen. No ongoing communication to keep people from panicking, no action. 
Only when I alerted the rooftop bar an engineer sprang I to action. But even at that point no communication flow to the people inside nor to me. Luckily my partner had his phone and I was able to give him and the people inside updates on what I saw happening. Please have standard procedures with good communication put in place for things like that. 
Afterwards they offered us a complimentary tea time, which was very nice.
Review_Title: Very nice hotel and amenities. Great location.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King, Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review:
Beach view, beds - OMG so comfy. The team working at the hotel were amazing at all times. Nothing was too much trouble and they were always subtly looking out for you to make sure everything was looked after. I had a rude guest trying to repeatedly push past me in quite a full-on way in the breakfast queue, the lady checking people in for breakfast noticed this and personally made a point to serve me first and escort me to my own table. All without making a fuss. 
Also, Tai deserves a shout-out - he was so helpful both on my arrival and also with some internet questions I had (the internet was fine and fast btw).

For the gluten-free, GF bread was available at breakfast, often sweet varieties (with berries etc).
Negative_Review: All I can fault are the lifts. They are slow for a hotel of this standard, It's a big hotel with a lot of guests but the lifts seem to run really inefficiently. And on a couple of occasions, all of the floors pressed cleared and we ended up going the other way for a while. First-world problems but not in line with the rest of the hotel experience.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: The staff are lovely and friendly.
Negative_Review:
We could not stand another night! Left earlier than we booked for and decided to stay at a hotel nearby. 

The issue was black mould on the walls. Terrible upkeep of this supposedly upmarket hotel. The entire building has a musty smell that is covered by a staff member continuously walking around with deodoriser. 


Details we want to share but you may not want to read:
My wife has severe allergies to any mould. The first room we were given was appalling (see photos) and her allergies broke out immediately. We returned to the Lobby and waited over 2 hours for them to find us another room. 
When they found a room my wife inspected before we moved our luggage and it also had mould. They showed us a 3rd room and it was better (still had some mould but not as bad). The manager tried to suggest the black was "glue" from the wallpaper... Glue doesn't cause her allergies to flare up, mould does. 

After 2 sleepless nights we couldn't take anymore and decided to cut our stay short and find another hotel with vacancies in the area. 

Acknowledgements:
The manager did try to help us. He also gave us 2 free massage tickets. Although, he took one of them back after realising each one was for 2 people. He then explained how we "have to appreciate how difficult it has been for him." (Direct quote He said to me). After taking back the massage voucher he then gave me 2 free beers in the lobby bar. 
Seems they lack understanding that we were the customer and weren't getting sleep because of the atrocious state of their rooms. Expecting us to have sympathy for him somehow... 

We would recommend you choose very carefully and consider some of the other hotels in the area. Our experience with Four Points by Sheraton was horrific and we would not want anyone else to have a similar experience.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Staff were lovely
Negative_Review:
The ocean view rooms are very noisy with traffic noise until midnight and then starts again around 530am.
The design of the room has the smoke detector directly above the bed, which flashes all night long. When the lights are out it is magnified. The hotel is aware of the problem and offers an eye mask.
Staying on lower floors means you have to wait for elevators repeatedly (full from higher floors), especially at peak hours, which in the morning if you're trying to leave at a specific time for a work meeting is very frustrating (walking 8 flights of stairs not a preferred option).
Review_Title: Noisy and not restful rooms. Wouldn't stay here for work travel again.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 1 GiÆ°á»ng King, HÆ°á»›ng Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Location, facilities, view, breakfast
Negative_Review: The room was humid, so much that the bedsheet were wet and the carpet a bit smelly. We dried the bedsheet with the hair dryer the first night, because we arrived at midnight and were too tired to ask for a new room. We did it in the morning but they said they had no more rooms available (with so many rooms I doubt it, but still). They offered to deep clean the room and change the bedsheet. We said we preferred to have a different room as the humidity was clearly non going to be solved by cleaning the room, but no chance, that was the only option. Well, the room was cleaned so and so, the humidity was the same (all my clothes were wet, the passport cover bent) but we didn't tell anything anymore as we stayed only 2 nights and there was no point in spending our holiday complaining. Also, there was not much collaboration from the hotel staff on the matter. However, that's no way to solve an issue in a high quality hotel like that and at such an cost. Ah, they offered us 2 small beers for our trouble..

RoomType: Suite á» GÃ³c CÃ³ 1 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§, 1 GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King, Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng

Also, in Booking.com, a sofa bed was listed, but upon arrival, Hotel Staff said its a sofa and not a sofa bed. Blamed everything on Booking.com.
Additional Bed will need to be charged. 
After a friend intervened and contacted the hotel manager, then was a bed provided FOC. 

Upon checking into the room, a stain was noticed in the tub. It was cleared after informing the hotel.

Lift were slow in the hotel. During peak hours, took pretty long to reach the lobby if there are many stops in between.
Review_Title: Passable. Next time do not book via Booking.com

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n, NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘, Ban CÃ´ng
Negative_Review: Unpleasant experience. Small pool, old room and facility, breakfast has limited choice. Unfriendly staff.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n, NhÃ¬n Má»™t Pháº§n Ra Biá»ƒn, Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Excellent breakfast. Nice cosy hot tub.
Negative_Review:
1. This property is dated and needs freshening up. The rooms are dated, and the bathroom fixtures, fittings, silicone needs an update.

2. Not centrally located, you need a taxi to go to the centre as it is quite a long walk away.

3. The glass auto-sliding doors at the front of the building does not have a sticker on them. In certain light conditions, it looks like the door is open, even though it is actually closed. Unfortunately, I walked straight into the glass door at speed (in the afternoon on my way out), and bruised my knee on the first day. I reported my injury in the evening to the front desk and even stated the date/time when it happened so she could check, but the staff did not understand a word. She asked me to use a translator app and I typed into the app. . I specifically asked for medicated oil to help rub into the bruise (next day is ok too given that I stayed for 3 nights), and I provided feedback that they need to put stickers on the door to avoid similar future incidents. The staff I spoke to, said they will put stickers on the door during the next day. I received no compensation, no medicated oil, and no sticker on the door. I am utterly disappointed by the staff in handling this matter. At the very least, I would have expected them to make the doors safer for other customers, but that did not happen during my stay.

4. Partially blocked view of the sea, largely due to the unpleasant view of the high rise building construction happening next door.
Review_Title: Fab breakfast, but let down by the dated accommodation, and the handling of the auto-sliding doors that caused my bruise

The breakfast has a lot of options. I felt like you're at a restaurant. There is a Spanish, Korean, Indian and Vegetarian corner besides the Vietnamese one of course. Everything is very clean and the rooms are very big.

The facilities such as the outdoor en indoor pool are also nice to cool down during the hot days.

10/10 I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Positive_Review:
The staff in incredible. It was my birthday the day after my arrival and they upgraded my room, I had a birthday cake sent to my room and the night before I left Thoa brought me a great cookies and tea, and the cleaning staff had a gift for me.
When I first walked across the river one of the girls (I know she lives in Canada, but I don't remember her name) walked with me to the bridge to make sure I was on the right side of the bridge. The staff is the best staff I have ever met in a hotel.
Negative_Review:
The restaurants. I tried to book a table on the 37th floor, but it was fully booked and I was escorted to the bar where I could have table on a bar chair facing the window-I said No thanks as I am travelling alone and I want to see other people.
I finally booked a table on 3rd floor, and I was the only client in the restaurant most of the time. I tried to order Gin and tonic, but the waiters (they were 7 there) did not know what I was ordering and I tried for 15 minutes to explain to them this famous drink, bot no they did not understand. I finally had very bad hamburger and sparkling water.

Positive_Review:
The room is clean and very comfortable. Bed is extremely comfortable. Shower facilities are great too 

We have a clear view of the Han River, the Dragon Bridge (not able to view the Dragon breathing fire show from the room; partially block by another building, but it is a short distance to walk to the Dragon Bridge) and the Han Bridge (unfortunately the bridge is under maintenance works and did not rotate on the Saturday night) 

Great location: walking distance to the night market, Dragon Bridge and Vincom Plaza where you can go for food and shopping

The service at the hotel was exceptional as well. Staff are helpful and pleasant. I had a wonderful experience. Please give Thoa and Uyen your staff awards. They are extremely helpful, helping me with the planning of the tour trips, excellent recommendation of trip, tour guide and bookings of the vehicle

I stayed for a total of five days, and I am not disappointed with the breakfast buffet which is provided at the restaurant: with a variety of food to choose from, and they even change the breakfast items to provide more choices 

Food at the Han River restaurant is excellent, with very friendly staff
Review_Title: Overall, I had a great experience, friendly staff and the amenities are great

For the second night, thanks to the amazing work of the staff, they offered us a twin room (which we originally booked but it was not available at first) where we could sleep much better.

Negative_Review: The bathroom was grungy; around the shower floor needs updating, the shower didnâ€™t drain properly and then leaked all over the bathroom, the mirror was very dirty upon arrival. I chose this hotel because it boasted 2 pools and 4 restaurants but one restaurant was only open for breakfast, one was closed (buffet), and that left a fancy steakhouse for dinner or the a la carte menu. Positive_Review: Location is great. Views are nice, but dirty windows take away from views.
Negative_Review: This is the 4th and worst MeliÃ¡ hotel I've stayed at in Vietnam. No welcome drink offered to us, although other guests being served in front of us. Dirty windows in panoramic view room. Shower drain clogged, almost 3cm of water in shower floor during showers. Room door lock failed. Went down to lobby to change keycards then tried door still not working, called service from hallway phone explained no keys worked so it's not a key issue but a lock issue. Waited 30min in hallway for "engineer" to arrive, called 2 more times to ask for help. He finally shows up with only a keycard, no other tools, surprise it didn't work. We went down to lobby to explain the issue again, drop off a bag we couldn't put in room, let them know about shower drain, and went out without being able to freshen up in the room. Staff acted polite but didn't do anything to help after nearly an hour dealing with this. During checkout receptionist tells me they will check room (common) and for me to come back to counter in 10min, 5* hotel tells guest: you guest come back to counter, all other hotels they come let the guest know, To top it off during checkout they tried to charge me for snacks in the room, room never had any snacks or drinks besides free coffee packets. I wouldn't complain about any of these if single issues but together they show poor service and attention to detail. I won't be back.

Positive_Review: convenient location, great river view from my room
Negative_Review: long check-in, staff did not assist to find the correct elevator, I was struggled with the locker and card. Towel and floor seemed not very clean. I got a stomach problem with the breakfast on July 21, suspected mild food poisoning.

RoomType: Suite
Negative_Review:
I booked the suite room in the hotel for 5 nights and my experience was terrible to say the least. On checking in I was given a room which was completely different from the photographs shown online and was infact the smaller room and not the bigger suite which I had booked. I complained and they said that the pictures online were wrong. I asked for a refund, but they finally agreed to give me the the suite which I had booked originally. I wish my troubles had ended there but it was not to be.

My room was not cleaned even once during my stay even though it was mentioned to the reception multiple times. They said they were too busy and short staffed ( this coming from a major 5 star hotel and any random boutique hotel amazed me.) They promised everyday that my room would be cleaned the next day but that didn't happen. Because of this I didn't receive my complimentary water. I tried calling the reception multiple times to get water but no one answered. I would be out the whole day exploring Danang so they ample time to do basic housekeeping but clearly this was not important to them. I did receive a note of apology on the 5th morning of my stay promising to take care of the situation however when I returned at night the room was again not cleaned as usual.

I'm not one to leave bad reviews normally but I can't imagine how one a hotel as big as this can't do something as simple as basic housekeeping.

The only good thing were the views from my room, which I almost didn't get if i didn't ask for a refund so in short great location, good views but horrible service and terrible staff. Won't be back here for sure.

A great location to visit Danag downtown. The staff is friendly, the price is great. There's a small shopping mall in 10 mins walk, and can visit most spots via walking. You can book airport pick-up service in advance. The pool is wonderful, amazing view! The SPA is great, more expensive but the service is wonderful.

Positive_Review: SchÃ¶ne Suite, waren im 30. Stock, Aussicht Richtung Meer. Gutes FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksbuffet, gute Lage. Liebe Geste zu meinem 30. Geburtstag bekam ich ein TÃ¶rtchen aufs Zimmer und einen lieben Brief vom Front of House. Tolles Fitnessstudio! Haben einen Abend im Restaurant gegessen - PERFEKTES STEAK! Negative_Review:
Sind als "Backpacker" angereist, d.h. mit Rucksack, aber ordentlich, ganz normal gekleidet!
Wurden an der Rezeption extrem skeptisch begrÃ¼ÃŸt, mussten den Welcome-Drink im Stehen trinken, wÃ¤hrend jeder andere erst Mal in der Lounge willkommen geheiÃŸen wurde - und das alles obwohl wir eins der teuersten Zimmer des Hotels gebucht hatten, um dort meinen runden Geburtstag zu feiern! 
Das Hotel hat da direkt in den ersten Sekunden einen negativen Eindruck hinterlassen und konnte dann nur noch verlieren. Da sieht man Mal was eine gute Rezeption ausmacht, der erste Eindruck ist so wichtig; wir kommen selbst aus der gehobenen Gastronomie und wissen wovon wir reden. 
Wir wurden auch nicht aufs Zimmer begleitet wie Ã¼blich, sondern mussten den Weg zum Aufzug und zur Suite selbst suchen. Dort war es dann ganz hÃ¼bsch, allerdings wie gesagt, nach so einem ersten Eindruck fallen uns dann ganz andere Dinge auf: leere Wasserflasche mit alten Zigarettenstummeln vom VorgÃ¤nger auf dem Balkon, Staub unter dem Esstisch, dreckiges Handtuch im Bad. Reklamiert haben wir nur die Zigarettenstummel, welche entfernt wurden samt Entschuldigungsschreiben.
Beim FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck ist noch anzumerken, dass es sehr schade ist in einem Hotel dieser Klasse, dass nur am Morgen der Tisch eingedeckt wird. Kommt man etwas spÃ¤ter (halb 9!) liegen schon keine Stoffservietten mehr auf den PlÃ¤tzen und ab halb 10 wird begonnen das Buffet abzubauen/fÃ¼r den Abend einzudecken, was eine recht ungemÃ¼tliche Stimmung macht. 

Alles in allem war es okay, aber unsere Erwartungen waren deutlich hÃ¶her. 
Preis/Leistung stimmte fÃ¼r uns leider nicht ganz.

Positive_Review: Loved the pools, the WIFI was excellent, the breakfast was a great mix of Asian and western. Ordered room service 3 times and it was fabulous and pricewise better than I would get in Australia. Had my laundry done. Ordinarily I wouldn't do this as it's too expensive, but Vietnam is cheap to eat, live and do laundry and the quality of all three was evident at this hotel.
Negative_Review: I tried to book a tour to Bana Hills through the hotel but they wanted to send me to the train station or bus station to make my own way there. I went online and booked it and the tour company took care of the rest.

RoomType: Suite Executive - NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed. The location is perfect: directly across the street from a nice swimming beach and a short walk to find restaurants, shopping, massage, etc. The hotel is beautiful and deserves its 5 star status; great gym, 2 pools, afternoon tea and a fabulous breakfast. Our room was very large, clean, cool and quiet The employees were always smiling, helpful and polite. There were two employees who really were very helpful and deserve special recognition. They are Ngoc who is a hostess in the dining room and Henry who is the front desk manager. We extended our stay several times and Henry was always very helpful and kind in looking out for our comfort. Ngoc is a very special person indeed. She realized early on that we are vegetarians and made sure that we had special vegetarian options available on the breakfast buffet and she introduced us to local vegetarian specialties. She is a kind, thoughtful, generous person and we will always remember her. She is truly an asset to DLG Hotel. We highly recommend this hotel in Danang.

Our room had a seating area and bedroom with large bathroom with bath and separate shower area. The room was spacious and good views of the front beach area. All staff are approachable and friendly.Highly recommend and will definitely stay here again. Value for money

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel:

-First and foremost, hotel staff was great. They always welcome you with a smile on their faces and are so kind and helpful. Be it the security waiting outside, receptionists or staff in the restaurant, they were all so nice and helpful.

- The cleaning staff did a great job, room was as clean as it could be! It was not cleaned the first two days and it turned out I pressed the â€œdo not disturbâ€ button on the wall, next to the lights while looking for the lights. So if you check in late night as I did, FYI! 

- The hotel has a great location. You cross the street and you are on the beach. The only issue is, traffic lights or respecting the lights is not a thing in Vietnam. Thus, crossing the road is a little bit risky for fellow westerners who are not used to cars/motorbikes driving on you and honking while you try to cross the street. But it will be the same wherever you go on that beach line.

- It is also walking distance to the restaurants. Get out of the hotel, turn left and you will see famous seafood restaurants in a few minutes. But I would recommend you to turn right, walk 10-15 minutes and try other seafood restaurants which are basically 30%-50% cheaper for the same fancy seafood like giant lobsters and you will not have to wait an hour to be served. Unfortunately I discovered it on my last night!

- I used the airport shuttle from the airport to the hotel and highly recommend it. I took a taxi on my way back to the airport and it is half the price of the shuttle service. They are both cheap anyway but when you take the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, you know you will not be scammed as opposed to taking the taxi. 

- I also asked how I could visit Lady Buddha statue and reception arranged me a car to do some sightseeing. I also recommend that since the driver will wait for you while you are visiting those places and you will have a comfortable trip.
Negative_Review:
- Breakfast was a hit or miss. It was a giant ASIAN food buffet. And as you may know, Asian breakfast is not much different from Asian dinner. Thus, you will love it if you are okay with having fried rice, sauted beef with oyster sauce and veggies or sushi for breakfast. Or else it will be a bit challenging.

- Also, you will see that the food is not replaced with the same food when it is finished. Thus, breakfast around 7:30 am is slightly better than breakfast around 9am. Likewise, there were some people who were literally taking all the papaya, rambutan and pineapples to their tables (around 2kg each) which were being replaced with watermelon. It is kind of annoying if you want to have one of those fruits and see the same people taking all the fruits to their tables everyday!

- If you decide to take the tuktuk, reception can arrange it for you. However, check the price with the reception before getting in the car since the driver tried to charge me more than double the amount I was quoted. It was still cheap but knowing you are being overcharged was unsettling.

- Unfortunately smoking is allowed in the hotel. You will see people smoking in the lobby or Sonata restaurant. So it might be an issue if you intend to spend some time there and are sensitive to smoking indoors.

- The worst part of my stay was sleepless nights. I had horrible neighbors on the floor. An English speaking family coming to the room from 3am to 5am, fighting with their little son to make him go to sleep and then fighting with each other since the boy did not want to sleep. And unfortunately calling the reception at 5am to remind those guests that people were sleeping did not work either. A Vietnamese family with at least 2 boys going to breakfast/beach around 7am in the morning, arguing with the father and each other and shouting on all their way in the hall. A Korean family doing the same around 8am. So, as you can imagine, I had many sleepless nights despite the comfort of the bed.
Review_Title: Definitely recommended, hopefully with less noisy guests on the same floor!

Negative_Review: All was good however really disappointed with a strict smoking policy of outside only which seemed to be totally ignored by whom I assume were local patrons . People smoking by the lifts and openly smoking in the indoor bar area . I smoke but feel important I donâ€™t impose that on others . if you have a smoking policy you have to enforce it or itâ€™s all a bit pointless ! I informed reception but it would appear to fall on deaf ears and it took ages for ashtrays to be emptied by the lifts . just remove them ! it kind of sends the wrong message . Another point to note for hotel is when watering plants the access water drains out onto slippery marble and is a real safety hazard for slips . This sounds all a bit negative but overall I would stay again , just points for improvement . also the welcome drink was around the same quantity of mouthwash I use in the mornings before brushing my teeth . The bar restaurant served good food at a reasonable price although you could better use the outside area for seating to encourage patrons to also eat there .

 out of our clothese which they delivery that evening. I had a sick son who we put to sleep after hours and this woke him 
 up. No courtesy or common sense used by staff that they should not call any customer at midnight. 
 Again, complaint fell on deaf ears and no compensation.

Positive_Review: Modern and one of the best hotel room layouts Iâ€™ve ever seen. Also liked the laundromat and absolutely loved the rooftop pool and lounge area. The chill out music up there added to the great vibe. While I didnâ€™t like Danang city much at all, it was always pleasant to come back to the hotel and feel like I could relax in peace up at the pool. The General Manager, an Australian expat, was super helpful and invested in checking in on guests whenever he was passing by. Other staff were courteous and friendly, although Google Translate helps with communication.
Negative_Review: They have a stunning rooftop pool and lounge/bar but the pool closes at 7pm!! It seems ludicrous to close it so early when they have such a great city view at night and it is too hot for many people to be up there before the sun goes down. My son and his friend missed out on using the pool because the only time it was comfortable for them to be up there was after dinner.
Review_Title: Modern luxury at a very reasonable price

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Signature Wink Gia ÄÃ¬nh HÆ°á»›ng SÃ´ng NhÃ¬n Ra Cáº£nh HoÃ ng HÃ´n
Positive_Review:
It is a brand new hotel with interesting techy-concept. We were staying in the river-view family room which is not very big, but was nice and comfortable, with an excellent view of river, city and Dragon Bridge. There is a laundry room where you can wash (for 2 USD), dry (for 2 USD) and iron your cloths, which was big plus for us. It was not very clear how to pay for the laundromat with credit-card, but we called for help, and they came to assist us in couple of minutes. 
There is also very nice terrace at the roof. Hotel is 5 minutes walk away from the Dragon Bridge and night market. Also, there is a great shopping centar "Vincom Plaza" few minutes walk from the hotel (in the direction opposite from Dragon Bridge). We really liked our stay in this hotel, and would warmly recommend it to others.
Negative_Review:
It was rather chaotic in the dining room during the breakfast, and not very clear what is available for breakfast, and where to find what to drink and eat Also, it was very difficult to find table to sit. 
There is no ability to open any kind of window in the room. We were staying in the hotel for just one night so it didn't bother us much, but for a longer stay I would prefer to have ability to open the window and not depend just on air conditioning. 
Hotel was bombarding us with too many promotional messages, and many of those were not relevant for our stay in the hotel, so at the end we stopped reading them eventhough some of them might have been useful.
HotelName: Wink Hotel Danang Riverside - 24hrs Stay & Rooftop with Sunset View

Positive_Review: The view from the room was nice and also the location was really good.
Negative_Review:
To begin with, the bedrooms are just too tiny. There is not enough space to place our luggage, so we had to put it on the floor and therefore, no space to walk on the room. We actually put the label outside the door of "no disturbing" so we didnt have to take our luggage from the floor for the cleaning ladies.

The bathroom was also really tiny (so tiny that the door to close the bathroom is the same to close the shower). While in the shower, with the closed door, there was no light inside. The shower was just too complicated to use. We left our stay without understanding how to use it. Why complicate?
Please, equip the bedrooms appropriately. 

The worst part came in the end. We wanted to use the pool and the staff told us there was "a private event" going on in the rooftop and therefore, guests could not use the pool. This is not from this planet. How is it possible to do "private events" on a hotel proibiting guests to use the hotel facilities????? When we booked this hotel, one of the filters was having a pool, and here we are, being rejected by our own hotel to relax during our stay. The staff was super rude when comunicating this. 

We will never for sure come back to this hotel or any other "Wink" hotel.
This is the 5* star hotel more boosted we have ever seen. For us this was a 3* hotel at most.
HotelName: Wink Hotel Danang Riverside - 24hrs Stay & Rooftop with Sunset View

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Premium - NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
*Our day manager Ms. Sunny was lovely. She was able to help us out a few times with getting a stronger hairdryer and getting more towels.
*Breakfast is excellent. Lots of choice and they leave the ingredients out so you can mix and match.
*The pool is pretty cool and looks like an infinity pool from the right angle making it great for photos.
*The massage was much better than anticipated. In particular, my masseuse (Ms. Thu) massively outperformed. It may be the cheapest and best massage I got during my holiday.
*Loved the bed, nice balance between hard and soft
*The location right next to the beach is both the best and worst thing (see below).
Negative_Review:
*If you are coming from a country that is ahead on time be careful as the area is really noisy until about midnight, unfortunately we had to try to sleep with a literal nightclub outside. 
*Don't use the Booking.com app to communicate, it's useless. We ended up in a telephone game about the taxi that could have been resolved much quicker with direct contact.
*If you have long hair, use the hairdryer outside the bathroom as the power in the bathroom is really weak and fluctuates a lot.

The second story

Review_Title: Beautiful stay, perfect hotel! Would definitely return

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe
Positive_Review:
Everything was great basically. We had a fantastic vacation in Danang. The hotel is well-located, though it's not in the city center, the dining options around are limited, but it's easy to reach by taxi (around 10-15 mins) to and from the city center. 

The view is amazing, even with the partial sea view room. Room is clean and tidy. Elevator needs keycard to acess which is great. Breakfast is delicious with a lot of options, both local, Asian, and western. The restaurant is wonderful with several vegetarian options. 

The highlight for me would be the spa. We had a complimentary sauna for >3 nights of stay and I booked the massages twice - amazing experiences, very professional and of great quality. The massage rooms are sea front, which is another plus. 

So in general it's really great for a relaxing vacation with family or friends or partner. The price for the room and other activities and services in the hotel is very reasonable.
Negative_Review: Nothing much. If I have to pick, I'd say the room is a bit small for a high-end hotel in southeast Asia. And the rooftop bar is right beside the pool, which can be a bit messy when it's busy.

Positive_Review: We only stayed one night in Da Nang but the Radisson hotel was perfectly good. Our room was on the smaller side but really nice. The staff were super helpful with our travel arrangements. They booked us a Taxi driver who took us on a great tour over the Hai Van pass - well worth it if you're heading north and have the time. The rooftop bar has stunning views even if the pool looked a little small. The beach is huge and seems to be the main attraction in Da Nang. There's not that much else to do, and not much else near the hotel, but Taxis are cheap and easy to book on Grab to go to more lively areas.

Positive_Review: Delightful 5 night stay in a corner suite with amazing panoramic sea views. Great location, right on the beach. Staff were lovely, especially Nhi who provided exceptional customer service, delivered with such genuine warmth. She made me feel so welcome and was always on hand to provide unbiased advice on tours, attractions & transportation. I will definitely be back.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe
Positive_Review:
Attentive, discreet & courteous - Radisson Hotel Danang

I was warmly greeted with an amazing drink followed by a precise introduction to all the facilities - that included a rooftop bar, an infinity pool with a breathtaking view, a fitness center, and a spa area.

The staff were courteous, friendly, and really attentive. At this point I would like to express a special thank you to Ms. Vy who assisted me by any matter with such professionalism & effort.

The breakfast was excellent! There were plenty of food options (also vegetarian and vegan options), pastries, and freshly squeezed juices. What really amazed me was that there was a cook who prepared warm meals (Phá»Ÿ, BÃºn BÃ², ...) or an omelette by order.

My room was modernly equipped and clean - there was nothing to complain about. At the push of a button, you could call the staff, have the room tidied up, and much more. Bottles of water, tea, coffee, and fresh fruits were provided every day.

I appreciate your hospitality and the four restful days. 
I will surely return!

Great location opposite the beach.

Comfortable room

Negative_Review:
Breakfast - where do I start. 
Iâ€™ve never seen so much food but yet so little I wanted to eat. 
This however seems to be the case in a few hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in in Vietnam. 
Suggestions I would make is to offer bacon, beans, mushrooms and tomatoes to accompany the variety of eggs on offer. Not a fan of stir fries or soups for breakfast. 
Larger selection of fresh fruit and yogurts would be nice. 
Coffee - a must have for most of us in the morning. I was shocked to have to pay for a latte. 
I didnâ€™t like the Vietnamese coffee on offer. 
Pillows - ones to soft the other is too thick which unfortunately I didnâ€™t sleep well for the duration. I didnâ€™t however actually ask for a different pillow, so they may have had alternatives. 

Lastly - training in cocktail making. for the high prices charged it was very disappointing to receive a thrown together cocktail. We tested a lot on the menu and most didnâ€™t taste like they should. 

The above are suggestions only. I did enjoy my stay and the staff were lovely.

Negative_Review: the Gym is a joke.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Premier CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn Vá»›i TrÃ  Chiá»u/Äá»£t LÆ°u TrÃº
Positive_Review:
Full disclosure: I had to checkout 2 nights early than my booking because my mother passed away, they gave me credit for that 2 nights so that i can use it next time i visit the hotel, and i thank hotel management for that, but this favor does not affect my review. 

The location is really good, closed to My Khe beach, An Thuong night market is around the corner, many restaurants are around, which help me to have good breakfasts during my stay. My room is ocean front which helps to view the ocean right in front of me, it would be better if there is balcony so i can fully smell the ocean. The room is big, which is suitable for me to work at the hotel sometimes, the light control is near my bed, which is very convenient. If you visit Danang for tourism only, you can skip what i don't like, if you visit Danang for work like me, you can read what i do not like about the hotel and the staff.
Negative_Review:
if you read the welcome book after you check-in, there is no mentioning about people who travels to Danang/this hotel to stay for work/business, this is origin of my complaints. 
Breakfast: most, perhaps all, hotels in Danang is offering buffer breakfast, as a result quality of breakfast is low, to my standard, however this is expected by me. What i do not like is this hotel does not offer a la carte breakfast, which saves my time and quality would be perhaps better. During my 14 nights stay, i skipped my breakfasts at this hotel, instead, i went to some restaurants around the corner for my breakfasts, which saved my time and quality is not the best, but acceptable to me. 
Staff: they do not distinguish which guest is for tourism only, which guest is for business, they assume all guests are for tourism, they can ask but they chose not to. They seemed surprised when i told them i stayed alone and they even asked why i stayed alone? If they asked, i would expect them to do everything they could to save my time during check-in and check-out but they didn't. Tourists might have plenty of time but i did and do not. This is problem of hotel management, who do not train their staff well.
Review_Title: Good for tourists but not good for business

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i, NhÃ¬n Má»™t Pháº§n Ra Biá»ƒn Vá»›i TrÃ  Chiá»u/Äá»£t LÆ°u TrÃº
Positive_Review: Very clean, nice pool, great views and location. Great afternoon tea and breakfast.
Negative_Review:
Booked a family room on booking .com 1 adult and 3 children age 12 months, 14 and 16. Arrived at the hotel and reception said the two children are adults and would cost more. So I asked to cancel my reservation as they were not complying with the booking .com reservation, however they said that I would be charged the full price, or I could pay the difference and they kept my passports until I paid the different. So I could not cancel which was very underhanded tactics of the hotel staff. 

The hotel lacked in facilities and did not cater for all. The smart TV did not have one single English channel and no Netflix. only YouTube and a Rosamia advert going round in a loop or Vietnamese channels. 

There are better facilities in 3 or 4* hotel.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Grand 3 NgÆ°á»i, NhÃ¬n Má»™t Pháº§n Ra Biá»ƒn Vá»›i TrÃ  Chiá»u/Äá»£t LÆ°u TrÃº
Positive_Review: near to beach
Negative_Review:
Its for sure not a global standard hotel to me! You cant compare its services with Marriot or Hilton. I have been traveling last 30 yrs and have been to many many countries but have never experienced people stopping me taking one extra whole fruit or a cake to room from breakfast buffet. It happened here. I was stopped and told I am not allowed to bring food to room. I had my reasons, we have near 2 yrs and 8yrs old kids sleeping. Often they dont want to sleep longer or dont want have breakfast. So what I was trying to do was hand carrying one slice of bread and one small slice of cake! I was very shocked! Explained to them but they didnâ€™t understand and insisted me not to. 
During breakfast the chef who was making egg omelette, used her finger (without gloves) to pick up something from the pan while frying the egg! I immediately told her, asked her to changed she didnâ€™t even look at me! 
Next day same happed to my son when he was hand carrying couple of banana bread slices for his sister (my daugher) as she has never been to breakfast and wants to sleep through. He was stopped and told to leave those food! We were 4 of us and had booking with breakfast. 
Secondly I have never stayed in a world class hotel where there is a big cockroach ğŸª³ flying in the room. I had to kill it. Photo attached! 
I found too many people in the reception and are talking between each other on something else when I am asking something. Also I had difficulty in communicating, its not English I mean its the willingness of the hotel stuff to help me! 
Vietnamese people are very kind and very nice to us all through the trip however this hotel stay actually made our experience quite bitter. I am avoiding this hotel in future and wouldnâ€™t recommend my friends as well.
Review_Title: ruined out Vietnam trip with bad experience

Positive_Review:
location is good, just walk across the road to the beach, walk to small supermarkets within 5 mins. I was told it is a relatively quieter side of the beach which I like. The room is nice with balcony and can hv a great view of the beach with no blockage. I read from other reviews that it may be noise during night time, the truth is sometimes there is music at the beach and it will only last till 10pm at night. The hotel has no control of it cos the music is from the resturant at the beach, yet the hotel keeps monitor the noise and report to police if it is over time. I stayed there for two nights and one night there is music, however, it stopped before 10pm. Meanwhile, if you close the balcony, there will hv no sound. 
Staffs at the hotel or at the resturant are supper nice and they are very curious of how is our stay, cos they want to improve their service, can feel every staffs give their heart for their hotel to serve us better. Definitely i will go back to the same hotel next time.
Negative_Review: not that i can think of, i enjoy every moment there.

RoomType: PhoÌ€ng Superior CoÌ GiÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng CÆ¡Ìƒ King NhiÌ€n Ra CaÌ‰nh ThaÌ€nh PhÃ´Ì
Positive_Review:
The room was absolutely beautiful, large and bright, very clean and lots of nice little details. Bathroom was great, separate toilet and shower which we liked. Powerful shower and nice products. Bed was comfy and clean soft sheets. 

The staff were amazingly attentive and always checking on us. Went the extra mile, gave us tips for local areas. One lady translated and arranged for a very precious item we left at a previous destination to be delivered by bus which we were so grateful for. 

The pool was also great, we swam on our own in the pool one evening and it was sheltered so you would be protected from the sun in the daytime. Food was fab for breakfast and we ate there in the evenings. 

If we are in the area again we will 100% come back. Thank you so much. Cam on Ban.

From the moment we arrived, the staff were fantastic. Iâ€™ve stayed in many hotels and this is some of the best service Iâ€™ve ever had. We arrived at 10am and had planned to leave our bags and head out but our room was ready for us which was a nice bonus.

The room was a decent size and was clean. The beds were comfortable and the air con worked well. The balcony was a good size and would have had a lovely view if it wasnâ€™t so foggy. Having a separate door on the toilet was a nice touch.

The steam room, sauna and pool were nice but the pool was freezing. We still enjoyed our swim and cocktails by the pool!

Breakfast was good as were the cocktails at the rooftop bar.

There was a loud party across the street at night but the GRO spoke to each group individually at breakfast and apologised which was unnecessary but showed good care.

For the price, this hotel is definitely worth it!!

RoomType: PhoÌ€ng Superior CoÌ GiÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng CÆ¡Ìƒ King NhiÌ€n Ra CaÌ‰nh ThaÌ€nh PhÃ´Ì
Positive_Review: Everything. The staff are so accommodating you get made to feel like royalty nothing is too much for them. The rooms are so so clean the pool is incredible and the sauna and steam room too. The roof top bar is beautiful and had live music on one of the nights. Location is right next to the beach. They gave us a free room upgrade for the whole of our stay because there was a noise issue the first night which wasn't even their fault...it was from karaoke which is actually quite far away and a resident who can't be told to be quiet until 10pm. I am a very light and early sleeper so I struggled with this but in the new room it was peaceful and quiet. The staff immediately changed our rooms and upgraded us to a suite. The suite was exceptional. Huge and I highly recommend the upgrade if on the fence even though our first room was beautiful. The buffet breakfast is amazing too a great selection of healthy food that's cooked for you. I had a fresh omelette with salad and a yoghurt with fruit every day my partner went for traditional Vietnamese brekkie which he loved - they even have fresh sourdough and rye bread. I love this hotel it's been my favourite in Vietnam.
Negative_Review: I think the breakfasts could go on till later. I don't usually eat until 11am so perhaps until 12. Especially on the weekends.

Review_Title: A wonderful stay at Sel de Mar wish we had longer to spend here! Gorgeous hotel along the seafront we upgraded to the ju

RoomType: PhoÌ€ng Superior CoÌ GiÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng CÆ¡Ìƒ King NhiÌ€n Ra CaÌ‰nh ThaÌ€nh PhÃ´Ì
Positive_Review:
We had an incredible stay at Sel de Mer! I was previously staying at another property in Da Nang that did not meet our standards. We booked our room late at night to check in the following day. 
We left our previous property as soon as possible and checked in to Sel de Mer. The front desk staff let us check in our bags and go to the pool. We were able to get into our rooms early, and they left us a nice arrangement in our room for our honeymoon.
The AC was AWESOME. It worked exceptionally well, which is needed in Da Nang. The beds were so incredibly comfortable. The showers worked great, and the soaps smelled really good. We got a city view room, which was amazing to look out at everyday.
The breakfast buffet is excellent. There are great options, and it was very tidy, well-stocked, and organized. The pool and gym are gorgeous and overlook the water. The gym also had a great variety of equipment.
Negative_Review: I will say that the location is a bit far from some local bars and restaurants. But that makes the property feel a bit more quiet and private. Getting a Grab is easy, so this was no no problem for us.
Review_Title: Beautiful and comfortable rooms in Da Nang!

RoomType: Suite Junior NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: We stayed in the junior suite with ocean view. We asked for the highest possible room as it was our anniversary and they were able to (25th floor) ğŸ˜Š Room was very spacious, modern, comfy, clean, great view and big TV. Bathroom very nice especially tub and great ventilation. Good walk-in wardrobe and plenty shelving next to desk to put all our clothes in. We were there for 7 nights so it made our stay more comfortable. Staff friendly and attentive especially the 2 guest relations officers. They would come to speak to us at breakfast every 1-2 days to check how our stay was and would attend to any issues/questions. Our shower drain was very slow to drain and they sent someone to fix it straight away. Room service, house keeping and reception is 24hrs. Free water bottles provided daily and more can be ordered as needed. Bartender named Chi (we think) at Speakeasy Bar on rooftop took great care in making our drinks perfect. Good gym, sauna, steam room and pool. Nice spa treatments. Breakfast buffet had good variety, nice fruit, juices, delicious pho/noodle soups, and great coffee. Room service food was good. We'd definitely stay here again.
Negative_Review: Nothing really, but just some suggestions for improvement. The pool area would have been better if there was a spa, if glass fence was kept clean to give a clear view of the beach and they played more chilled out music instead of pop/dance (btw I like pop/dance but it didn't feel right here). Windows in rooms could have been better sound proofed as we can hear all the street noise start from 5.30am or if there is a function across road in evening as they love the volume on the entertainment super loud lol (only happened 1 night luckily). TV would have been better if it allowed screen mirroring so I could watch my Netflix or YouTube off my phone ... or better still if it had Netflix and internet access. Breakfast was overall good, but some dishes could be better e.g. bacon, sausages, and have more hot vegetarian options.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
This beachfront hotel is hosted in a modern tower. Everything from the design of the taxi apron, to the modern, roomy and quiet lobby, as well as common areas reflects a good care for details. 

Very polite and attentive staff, quick and reactive, yet kind and welcoming - a great example of Eastern hospitality.
We appreciated the welcome ice tea for all our party - much needed with 105Â°F outside!

We took a twin room with a sea view and a balcony - unobstructed view of the long beach of Da Nang, just super. The room was US-standard in size, rather big , with large bathroom, big TV screen, well designed and with a perfect and intuitive a/c control.

Breakfast is a highlight. Much choice of Vietnamese as well as western food, very good quality and presentation. Nice breakfast room, large and with no major odors. Apparently bottomless supply of food. Polite maitre constantly checking for quality and customer satisfaction.

The hotel is located to more quiet northern end of the strip, with a huge portion of the beach waiting for your early morning undisturbed bath :) Nice, quiet and reasonably big infinity pool, not on rooftop, in case you need some shadow. Large and nice gym nearby the pool. A taxi ride to/from the airport takes less than 15 minutes. Attractive Hoi An can be reached by taxi in less than 40 minutes.

Considering also the fare, I would say one of the best hotel stays I had over the last few years. We just felt welcome, relaxed, and stunned by the gorgeous view. Would totally recommend, and hope to be there again soon.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
The hotel is right on the beach (across the road), rooms are modern and comfortable. One thing I would like to inform you, if you want to have some good food don't fall for the taxi drivers outside, just turn right on the road and walk down, you will come to a street full of restaurants on both sides of the road. All of these places have good food, just walk along and you can try over 100 places to eat there. I found this road to have lots of good places than the main road where most of these places are large establishments with sea food. There is a Beach Club just 1KM walk down also a good place for drinks and some full moon parties. 

The guest relationship manager was the best, she was always present while check-in, morning breakfast and even while we checked out, I give 100% to her she was a mini Wiki of knowledge, with a big smile. I think this is one of the few hotels who have got it right "customers come first". 

Next time I will definitely be staying here.
Negative_Review: Now, this is nothing to do with the hotel, but across the road there are two events places, where they do weddings, parties etc. and like anything in Vietnam they have to do karaoke that goes on till 10PM, so if you plan to sleep early good luck with that, lots of these guys think they can sing but believe me its a stretch.

Positive_Review: The staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English. The breakfast buffet was excellent. It was easy to grab a â€šGrabâ€˜ cab directly in front of the hotel but no in-App payment, just cash! We drove to charming Hoi An, 30-40 minutes away, every day. The hotel gym was good. The ocean views from rooms, rooftop bar, and pool area were stunning. The rooftop cocktail bar was wonderful- serving excellent cocktails, beautiful and delicious food. The cityscape at night made it worth the higher tab. There was no other restaurant or cafe nearby that we found at all appealing.
Negative_Review: To access the beach you had to cross the busy street without a traffic light. The stretch of beach in front of the hotel was very run down and did not permit swimming. The beach was dirty. The pool area and hotel room bath seemed a bit run down. The immediate neighborhood was very run-down residential, no restaurants or retail, lots of abandoned construction, torn up sidewalks, stray dogs. Sadly DaNang city seemed economically troubled and exuded zero charm.

Positive_Review:
The room is in immaculate condition, very clean and spacious.
We book a room for 3 nights with balcony facing the sea and the view is just lovely. 
Adequate training equipment in the gym for proper workout. There is also an infinity pool to just soak-in and relax while enjoying the beautiful scenery. 
Their rooftop Speakeasy Bar & Tapas at 26th floor is a must try. Beside the 360degree view, the bar also serves good foods and drinks at reasonable price. We ordered their teriyaki chicken skewer, nem lui (pork skewer) and baked oyster with cheeseâ€¦.yummy!
Last but not least, all the staffs are very friendly, professionally trained and speak good English. Special mention to Mr Tan Bao at Anemoi restaurant. So nice of him to go all the way to request the same baked oyster with cheese that we ordered the night before at rooftop bar even though this is not on the lunch menu. Thanks to the cook too for making such special arrangement on our last day! 
We will definitely stay here again whenever we are back to Danang.

Negative_Review:
Unfortunately need to go out and stand at the corner of the balcony to see the mountain view.

I stayed on level 19 and could hear neighboring businesses blasting music at night - so just be prepared for some noise nuisances which may be unavoidable at times.

We felt some aspects of the room could have been designed better, for example, the sliding door that opens to the balcony could be collapsed instead of stacked to one side. Stacking it effectively blocked 1/3 of the view. Also the shower does not have any place to put toiletries, we had to put the things on the floor.

Breakfast buffet egg station could do better. My sunny side up was soaked in oil, and the scrambled egg lacked the rich buttery flavor. Out of the eggs we tried, omelette was the best.

The hotel should place instructions on how to "on" the steam room. During my stay, if I needed to "on" it I had to ask a staff outside (so far is male) to enter the female toilet and help to "on" it. This left me feeling insecure during my use of the hot sauna that anytime a male could just walk in the female toilet to render assistance if needed.

There is no soundproofing in the room whatsoever and and even with the balcony doors fully closed, the noise is unbearable. We had to leave the room during that time. Complaints to the staff had no effect, no action was taken to make things right. We were on one of the higher floors, I imagine it could be even worse on the lower floors.

There were few other minor issues like leaking shower cabin or mediocre breakfast quality (especially the eggs!) but we would be fairly happy with the stay if it wasn't for the noise. Until this is fixed I'd definitely recommend staying somewhere else.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Gia Ä‘Ã¬nh NhÃ¬n ra Äáº¡i dÆ°Æ¡ng
Positive_Review: Overall the staff at the hotel are very pleasant, especially those at the the restaurant on level 2. We had a few meals during our 4 night stay there, service was great and the waitresses were really attentive to our needs.
Negative_Review:
1. The noise. I asked to give us a quiet family room when we were checking in, as I havenâ€™t had a good sleep for days in previous half of the trip in Hanoi. I was then told by the reception staff that they never had any complaint of noise from guests so I should not need to worry. It turned out that our beach view family room on level 8 was super noisy. The street traffic noise, the loud party music and karaoke for 2 consecutive nights from the restaurant or club across the street right in the beach, really negatively affected our entire experience. The balcony doors were not sound proof at all. When asking if possible to change to a quieter room, we were told the family room is only available up to Level 9 so changing room wouldnâ€™t make any difference. I am not sure if thatâ€™s true, but we decided to stay put with this information from the reception staff. 
2. upon checking out, we were falsely blamed for breaking a glass in the room. Maybe just because we had 2 kids staying? I am 100% sure no glass was broken by us during our stay, it might be their cleaning staff who broke it during cleaning and blamed on us. Rushing to check out to catch our flight, my husband did not bother to argue and just paid for the mysteriously broken glass. However I am extremely disappointed by this.
Review_Title: Very mixed experienced. Hotel is new and clean, majority
