RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King Vá»›i Ban CÃ´ng - NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review:
Goede kamer, groot, schoon en faciliteiten zoals gym, sauna, zwembad. 
Kwaliteit van eten ontbijt/diner/skybar is goed. 
Personeel spreekt goed Engels. 

Grote groepen (Korean) zorgen dat ontbijt zaal snel/vol zit in de ochtend, maar doorloop is prima en worst snel aangevuld.

Wij zaten met een aanbieding in dit hotel en dat was prima. Als wij de "originele" prijs (zover die bestaat) hadden betaald (250 euro per nacht) was dat echt te veel geweest.
Negative_Review:
De skybar en restaurant hebben weinig sfeer. Vaak zaten d'r maar 2 mensen en is het wat eerder afstandelijk dan gezellig borrelen te noemen. 

We wisten dat het hotel wat meer uit het levendige deel lag, en met 10-15 min lopen ben je wel in de gezelligheid, maar de route is langs de boulevard die ook niet overal even leuk is.

Tegenover het hotel is een conventiecentrum waar ook bruiloften zijn etc. Op drie dagen was dit het geval (van 5 dagen van ons verblijf), de muziek stopt wel stipt om 22uur.

Negative_Review: Colazione varia, ma giÃ  da prima delle ore 9 inizia ad essere sfornita, se chiedi alcune cose vengono rifornite. Positive_Review:
We spent five nights at this beautiful hotel and couldnt be happier!

+ Fantastic location right by the beach, sunbeds (not owned by the hotel) are available for only 40.000 VND/day
+ The staff was incredibly friendly, especially the assistant to the general manager went out of her way to accomodate us
+ Rooms were super cosy and spacious
+ Breakfast was excellent and offered a lot of variety
+ The rooftop pool was beautiful
+ lunch and dinner at Ciela rooftop bar was fabulous as well
+ beautiful & well equipped gym
+ numerous nice restaurants in the area
+ very affordable laundry service right around the corner of the hotel

Positive_Review:
We had the pleasure of staying at the Voco ma belle hotel. The hotel's facilities are simply top-notch. The pool and the view of the beach are truly incredible.
We had the pleasure of chatting with the hotel's staff - a great team! 
Linh was able to answer all our transport queries in excellent French.
We also met Henry, who made us feel so welcome. Henry is a very kind person, and gave us all the advice we needed to make our stay in Da Nang as pleasant as possible. 
He even took the time to recommend some really nice places for our next destinations.
We were able to communicate with Henry in Vietnamese, English and French! So don't worry, if you need anything Henry will be there for you!

Positive_Review: Best thing about my stay at voco Ma Belle was the staff. They were professional, friendly and extremely helpful about everything. Definitely exemplified IHG service standards (and it's always a good sign when you see management staff walking around checking on things and greeting guests). They made our stay so enjoyable that we missed voco Ma Belle when we moved to other resorts. Location of the hotel was very good. Easy access to everything. Also loved the rooftop infinity pool. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of food, although seem to cater towards Korean tourists (understandable but would have preferred more Vietnamese food options). Overall an excellent hotel. We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Da Nang.

RoomType: Suite Grand
Positive_Review:
- Incredible view of the ocean and the city from the Grand Suite.
- Beautiful suite and bathroom.
- The staff was friendly. Especially the manager. She asked us for our honest opinion and provided us with tea while we were waiting in the lobby. She was awesome and probably the most 5* experience about the hotel.
- Cocktails from the bar are delicious.
- Location of the hotel is great.
Negative_Review:
- Room service says it's 24h but it takes them forever to respond in the middle of the night (2AM+).
- Bed is not 5* comfortable.
- Rooftop bar needs renovations and was underwhelming in comparison to other sky bars in Da Nang.
- Overpriced for what it is.

Would come back if either the hotel invests in some renovations and upgrades or if the price was lower for the as-is state.
Review_Title: Good stay but more of a 4* than a true 5* experience

Positive_Review:
- Rooftop bar in the 40th floor: is a must try, even if you donâ€™t stay in the hotel. The view there is sooooo stunning, either in a moonlight light or a sunny day.
- Excellent service: we got a free upgrade thanks to booking.com promotion from a no view, no window room to a twin room with partial seats view so I was happy enough but Äá»‹nh the bellman made us even more happy as he walk our luggage to the room and realised we are travelling as a couple so he ask if we want to request a room change to double room and then the hotel is very nice to change it for free. Such a very thoughtful gesture. Äá»‹nh really went extra miles for customerâ€™s satisfaction. He helped us a lot with hotel information and taxi, too. Other staffs are also very welcoming. They really exceeded my expectations which premade from reading other reviews. Oh, and we got welcome drinks and food too :)
- Location: very near the beach and An Thuong areas where lots of shops and services are available. Our room is on the back corner of the hotel, floor 21 so we got a very beautiful view of the beach and the city while stayed away from the noise in the beach in the evening.
Negative_Review:
- The building and room was built a long time ago I guess so furniture and carpets look a bit old and worn out here and there, although still very clean. 
- The breakfast is not specially tasty but itâ€™s common in other Muong Thanh hotels too

Positive_Review: The hotel was very nice. Everyone that we encountered was accommodating and helpful. We arrived early and wanted an early check in. The front desk accommodated us without charge but wanted us to write a review first before even experiencing the hotel. The room did have some issues that were resolved quickly but they were issues. For example the shower knob was broken and we couldnâ€™t turn off the rainfall shower. The was room was very hot all the time and we finally asked on the last night for them to check it. They made some adjustment and it cooled off. Also our tv stopped working , again they replaced it right away. Other than that it was fine. The breakfast buffet is amazing and had many selections.! The location of the hotel is perfect and we had a great view of the Han River and itâ€™s about 1 mile from the dragon bridge. The Hanâ€™s market is maybe a 7 minute walk and there is a Starbucks right next door. Overall I would probably stay there again but I really didnâ€™t like how they asked me to write a review BEFORE actually experiencing or seeing the room. Oh and if youâ€™re looking for good Vietnamese food I highly recommend An ThÃ´i which is on the same street about 10 minutes down on the right. The food is delicious!

Very luxurious and a true 5 star hotel, except for few gripes, compared to our other experience in Ho Chi Minh city. Very spacious and well appointed room and hotel looks very new. The location, while little bit away from city center, still has many restaurants and it is on the river by front along with many other 5 star properties. 
The breakfast spread was really good with a dedicated vegetarian section. 
The bed was very comfortable, with good balance of softness to not to affect people with back pain problems.
Negative_Review:
The room service stops at 9.30 PM, too early, for a 5 star 24 hour norm. 
For strange reason, latte/cappuccino is served with long life milk, which has a very unpleasant taste. The breakfast team mentioned that chef would not allow them to have fresh milk - it spoiled our total breakfast experience.

Positive_Review: We stayed at the Hilton Danang over the course of 2 nights which covered our wedding anniversary and then new years eve itself. The hotel is nice and modern and definitely feels luxurious. The check in process is painless, and it's a really nice touch how they get you to sit in the lobby lounges during the process so that you don't have to be on your feet the entire time, which was especially nice after coming straight off a flight. The hotel is conveniently located by the Dragon bridge, but Danang itself is a town with many areas/ districts, so if you prefer being closer to the 'eat streets' or the beach, this may not be the best choice for you.
Negative_Review: Everything was great. We had the buffet dinner on new years eve which was amazing, and they even provided live entertainment through a magician. Negative_Review: Let me start by saying, the practices at this hotel is extremely unethical. They took a deposit that was way larger than the amount that we were supposed to be charged the day we arrived, okay no worries.. I can appreciate this. On the day we checked out, I was advised they would deduct our stay amount from the deposit.. this was not done. They asked for my card, I asked why? You have my deposit? He said in order to release the remainder of the deposit to you. I asked very clearly, so youâ€™re not going to be charging me? They said to me, no definitely not. I get to the car, and sure enough.. they charged me $1000AUD. I was told I would receive my funds back in 1 month because itâ€™s an Australian bank, after multiple complaints, they agreed to contact their back to release our deposit back to us in full within a few days (which I still havenâ€™t received back). Not to mention I paid $60AUD for a broken iron that was not damaged by us because I couldnâ€™t be bothered arguing with the staff any longer. Absolutely horrendous, I then received an apology letter for the error on Hiltonâ€™s part. Youâ€™d think, being such a large company with a big name, these sorts of practices would not occur. They would have not corrected their error, if I had not checked my bank transactions. Absolutely dodgey, would not approach with a 10 foot pole.

Negative_Review: We've spent 4 nights in 2 suite rooms with direct views of Han River. We paid the premium, and expected the best of comforts being in the suites. However, our rooms' tempatures consistently at above 26 degrees celsius or 78+ farenheit nights and days with full blast of air conditioning. It was unacceptable to bare and we had to switch floors in between. Hotel Management was very apologetics and acknowleged of air conditioning defects in all 28 suite rooms. They offered room discounts but nothing near the premiums we had paid for. As 5 five star hotel, should have been more honest of their constructiin faults and not marketing it to the public when problems are not solved. It does offer the best views, room size, and service. You should quality check these problems before engage in booking any suite facing the river.

Positive_Review: Room is big enough for family of 4. Has ocean view. Comfy bed

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Biá»ƒn
Positive_Review: Stayed for two weeks in Feb. gorgeous view, spacious room, kettle. comfortable bed, firm with pillow top. Extra pillows available on request. Daily cleaning was nice. Shower had nice glass door, no leaks (not common in SEAsia!) Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was extensive and had lots of options - western and Asian.
Negative_Review: Location is outside main area of town - 10-15 walk to main restaurant/bars. Beach was cordoned off due to jelly fish season. Also water had bacteria as we got rash from going in sea. Pool was COLD - its on shady side of building. Also steps have a 2.5 foot drop from deck to first step - not helpful for mobility issues. Music on pool deck too LOUD. Smoking allowed on pool deck.
Review_Title: Pleasant stay in nice hotel, friendly staff

Positive_Review: Very comfortable bed and nice clean room. Breakfast buffet had lots of options.
Negative_Review: Walls were very thin and other guest next door were extremely noisy from early hours in the morning. To the point we had to ask them to be quiet after being woken up at 6am, they then continued to be noisy regardless which made for an unpleasant experience.

Where do I start? Why this hotel is even 5 stars on booking.com? 
The Nalod Da Nang hotel is the worst hotel weâ€™ve ever been to.

We booked this hotel from Jan 23-29 and we decided to check out after 3 days because we had a horrible experienced.
One day before we traveled, we contacted the hotel for airport pickup, but unfortunately, the hotel never responded. It was raining when we arrived, we were very mad because if they communicate with us, itâ€™s much easier to travel going to the hotel and it's Lunaâ€™s New year so there are not so many taxis (not even a grab). After check-in, we went to our room and found 1 Pantyliner on the floor, disgusting! They donâ€™t even check the room though they had so much time because we arrived around the evening. 
On the next day, we ordered room service and unfortunately, the STAFF doesN'T UNDERSTAND ENGLISH! IS THIS A 5-star? 3x thatâ€™s happened. I said I donâ€™t want fries, they bring me a wrong order full of fries or even wrong order even though their Menu is English. The next day I ordered a pot of fish and I was so excited UNFORTUNATELY the pot have PORK BELLY! what recipe is that??? And not on the Menu that a Pot of steamed fish is with a pork belly. Lastly, I went to the breakfast and ordered a cappuccino, later I need to pay after My breakfast, WHERE IS THE FREE BREAKFAST THAT INCLUDED IN MY ROOM? Plus the Save box can carry by a person, not even attached to the wall (check the photos)
The only good thing Iâ€™ve experienced here is their massage atleast I had 1 hour to relax after all the terrible experiences. English is a very important communication which the hotel must give attention to. We can't handle what the hotel stress gave so we check out early. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS HOTEL! NOT EVEN RECOMMENDED TO MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS! 

Ps. I hope booking.com check the hotel before they became 5 Star.

Das Hotel scheint schon ziemlich alt zu sein, was der Ausstattung anzusehen ist. Dies zeigt sich auch im Fitnessstudio, das sehr sporadisch eingerichtet ist und allein vom Zustand der GerÃ¤te ein fortgeschrittenes Alter aufweist.

Die QualitÃ¤t und der Service beim FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck (kostenlos inkl.) lassen zu WÃ¼nschen Ã¼brig. Nach dem zweiten FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck entschied ich mich lieber etwas anderes auÃŸerhalb des Hotels zu suchen. Das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck wurde nur bis 9:30 Uhr angeboten, wobei ich beim ersten FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck bereits gegen 9:15 Uhr bestimmt darauf hingewiesen wurde, dass man gleich schlieÃŸe. Meine Bestellungen wurden vergessen und trotz Nachfrage nicht nach einer zÃ¼gigen LÃ¶sung gesucht. Das Essen schmeckte mir nicht (alles neutral oder abgestanden), obwohl es sehr auf vietnamesische Kunden ausgerichtet ist, was eigentlich eine bessere QualitÃ¤t vermuten lÃ¤sst.

Das Wifi kÃ¶nnte besser funktionieren. Mein erstes Zimmer lieÃŸ mir am zweiten Tag kein einloggen mehr zu, weshalb ich sogar ein kostenfreies Upgrade in ein Zimmer mit Seeblick erhielt (vielen Dank dafÃ¼r!). Der Wechsel musste (?) aber in wenigen Minuten stattfinden, so Stand der Rezeptionist in meiner TÃ¼r und wartete auch dort bei offener TÃ¼r, selbst nachdem ich um ein paar Minuten Zeit bat. Das Wifi im neuen Zimmer funktionierte grundsÃ¤tzlich, war aber langsam und auch nicht immer zuverlÃ¤ssig (kurzzeitig kein Internet oder keine Reaktion).

Leider war mein erstes Zimmer nicht ausreichend sauber. So fanden sich viele lange schwarze Haare in meiner Dusche, die definitiv nicht von mir stammen konnten. GrundsÃ¤tzlich war daran anschlieÃŸend alles sauber.

Alles in allem dominierte bei mir der Eindruck, dass trotz der zahlreichen Mitarbeiter des Hotels der Service qualitativ merklich ausbaufÃ¤hig ist (es handelt sich um ein 5-Sterne-Hotel). Auch sollten die angebotenen Speisen, ob kostenfrei oder kostenpflichtig, eine hohe QualitÃ¤t aufweisen, was sie aus meiner Sicht nicht taten.

Review_Title: Decent location, sea view, but hotel needs improvement

RoomType: PhoÌ€ng Superior 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhiÌ€n Ra BiÃªÌ‰n
Positive_Review:
This is my FAVOURITE hotel, and I will stay here next time im in Da Nang as well. When we first came me and my boyfriend had a beautiful room with seaview, then we was supposed to move room to a room with city view. But instead we got a call the morning with the news that we was upgraded to a bigger room with seaview. And this room is the most beautiful room I`ve ever stayed at! 
The room service was so good. They cleaned our room every morning, we got water two times a day and they fixed our room ready for night in the afternoon. 
The breakfast was good, with the cutest waiters. 
The gym was nice and new, and had all the equipments I needed for a full body workout. 
When we checked out the receptionist came after us with a present- it was a nice wooden model of the hotel. This was the perfect souvenir for us. 
I also loved the location- the beach was just over the road and there was many nice cafees and restaurants in short walking distance. The guards in the car park was always so nice when we came with our scooter. 
Highly recomment the hotel!
Negative_Review:
More aircondition in the hallways and in the elevator would be nice. But there was nothing I really didnt like. 
My only comment to the gym is that I would love to have a squat rach with different plates. Then the gym would be a 10/10.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
Positive_Review:
Great hotel on the beach road at the start of the town center. Check in easy and quick . we had a town view room which was fine, large and spacious with a nice sitting area. The room was clean and service daily always had water provided.
Restaurant for breakfast was very good with western and Vietnamese options available. Evening quieter but the food choice again is good and very reasonable.
The beach opposite the hotel is clean and with plenty of space.
For us the big benefit was the hotel pool private and plenty of place to sit.
We used the hotel transfer to Danang airport ,very convenient and dropped us off at the domestic terminal for our flight to Hanoi.
Staff were very helpful and a credit to the hotel.
I would stay again on a repeat trip.
Negative_Review: Disappointed that the Sky lounge bar on the top floor was closed at the time of my visit . This maybe due to just reopening after covid.
Review_Title: Great place to stay opposite the beach.

RoomType: Suite Harmony CÃ³ 2 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§ vÃ  Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Altara Suites Da Nang is kind of an apartment hotel type arrangement. What we liked about the hotel is that the rooms are pretty generous and large. We booked 2 rooms for a family of 5 adults, and the room for 3 had 2 separate bedrooms, which is really nice. The whole place is spacious as it resembles more like an apartment than a typical hotel where everything is crammed together.
Negative_Review: The service was just OK and typical of larger hotels. The problem for us is that we have been spoilt by the quaint, smaller and more boutique hotels in places like Hanoi and Hoi An, where their service is impeccable and staff were eager to serve and pamper guests really well. It's not that Altara Suites' service is bad, but just in comparison, the care isn't as felt as the other hotels. Also, we were quite hard pressed to find good places to eat nearer the hotel, so we felt kind of "stuck". Da Nang itself was quite boring - or at least the area the hotel is in - there's nothing to do.

Negative_Review:

Positive_Review: Good location across from beach, 2 bed rooms spacious, comfortable and clean. Strong WiFi. Washing machine and dryer, larger fridge than normal a bonus
Negative_Review:
Breakfast - eggs cooked fresh but forget the rest, sub standard buffet, however enough to eat. 

Not a criticism of the hotel directly but arranged a trip to Ba Na Hills through reception (private car and driver return to Ba Na Hills cost 1,000,000 Dong) and was advised to buy the buffet lunch at Ba Na Hills - avoid the buffet lunch!! The hotel breakfast which I just mentioned was Michelin star quality compared to this stuff. Literally inedible. Would not allow my dogs to eat it. Grotesque. Stale, dried out, tasteless - and that's being generous. Lot's of other food options at BaNa Hills, so my best advice is to just buy your entry ticket (900,000) and have some cash for lunch elsewhere.

Positive_Review: The view from the pool area.
Negative_Review:
It was absolutely filthy! All of the reviews mentioning how dirty it is, were true, sadly. 

From the grease marks in the kitchen, over the clapboards, on the fridge, to the dirty floors, hair in the shower drains, really unclean lounge, dirty dining chairs and gross bed heads to smelly pillowsâ€¦the list goes on and onâ€¦I cleaned my room for over an hour and the little towels were black afterwards. The second dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in over 25 years of travelling the world. 

The lifts were absolutely filthy - finger marks everywhere, greasy and SO SLOW. There were 3 lifts in total, but it seemed only one worked, and people lined up for ages for the dirty lifts.

The reception area was dirty, smelly and just so unwelcoming and drab. 

The whole experience made you feel like you needed to shower constantly and wash your hands every minute.
Review_Title: Donâ€™t stay hereâ€¦find somewhere else in Danang!

RoomType: Suite Harmony CÃ³ 2 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§ vÃ  Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review: The space in the 2 bed apartment is good for 4 people.
Negative_Review:
The photos are very misleading. The property needs a good uplift and paint at the very least.

The gym has dated equipment, there are only 3 lifts to service 33 floors, no goods lift either so you spend most of your time waiting for a lift to either leave the hotel, go to your room, pool or restaurant and the lift lobby except the ground floor has no a/c - very unpleasant and frustrating.

The staff in the pool area speak very little English. Our orders were wrong and again very frustrating, especially as they insisted we pay for their mistakes.

I knew it was going to be an interesting stay when we were checked in by 5 staff, some of them training but all very confusing!

Positive_Review: Where do I start? The property was very clean (my only complaint was the smell in the hallway - musty or mouldy) but that is my only complaint of our whole 7 night stay. The breakfast was amazing - so many choices including a separate vegan menu we could order from every day! A special mention to Linh unpstairs who was the most friendly and welcoming staff member! They even brought us soy milk every morning and remembered our eating preferences! The room was spacious, quiet, clean and had everything we needed - the washing machine and dryer were so so handy!!. We didnâ€™t eat in the room so only used the kettle and 2 cups for tea. The bed was the most comfortable king sized bed and we slept so well! The pool and gym were amazing and we really enjoying using those facilities (the views were incredible up there). We would 100% recommend altara suites and will definately stay again!

Positive_Review: The apartment came with a washing machine and dryer, which was very handy. The staff here was absolutely lovely and helpful. The staff was honestly the only saving grace of this hotel. Daily cleaning staff was very good too and make sure to mop every day. Reception and restaurant staffs are very helpful and courteous.
Negative_Review: There was mold on the air con vents. There were some suspicious discolourations on the ceiling as well from likely water damage. The reception area and lifts smelled like sewerage (the daily cleaning staff was really good and thorough from what we see, so it perplexed me where the stench came from, but it was very heavy and deep). They tried to use bleach to cover the smell, but it's still there. It most definitely was not a 5 star hotel standard. Upper management didn't maintain the hotel at all, despite the regular staff trying their best to upkeep the hotel. I would not feel annoyed if the number of stars actually reflect the condition of the hotel (3 stars would be more fair here).

Positive_Review: It was a nice spacious apartment with comfy beds and nice view of the beach as we were on the 28th floor. The location is withing walking distance to many spas and restaurants and minutes away from the beach, but if you are looking for beach chairs you will have to go much further down!
Negative_Review: The apartment it-self had a very stale and damp smell and the kitchen utensils and facilities were very used and had dirty stain marks on them and ther were ugly brown dirt marks on most of the curtain nets which were not displeasing! We had a problem with the shower as there is no hot water, but lucky enough there were two showers room available. I tried the breakfast on the first day and never went back, the choice was very limited! It was very crowded and beacuse the food was located one side, there was a big queue and the staff did not clean or filled up the food frequently compared to the amount of guest that was there. There was a main problem with this building is the lift, there was 3 lifts available but always seem like only one worked, I have waited nearly 3-5 mins from ground floor to reach 28th floor but at times it makes so many stops on the way which is quite frastrating every time you need to go out.

RoomType: Suite Serenity 2 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§ NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
Positive_Review: Near the beach and has two bedroom suite with dining table, ref, microwave and basic essential stuff
Negative_Review: It was not mentioned that there is currently a construction in front of the hotel. We thought we would be having city view with some beach views but because of the construction, we couldnt see any view. Also at first, aircon was not working but it was fixed so itâ€™s ok.
HotelName: Altara Suites Da Nang by AHG

RoomType: Suite Harmony CÃ³ 2 PhÃ²ng Ngá»§ vÃ  Ban CÃ´ng
Positive_Review:
We stayed in the Harmony 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom suite. The photos from Booking.com are accurate. In person, I would argue its even better. The view was BREATHTAKING. We were in suite 2706 which also has a bathtub.

Everything was so clean and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. You are provided with a washer and dryer and a small amount of laundry powder. We received four complimentary bottles of water each day which was much needed.

Loved the rain shower head and the air conditioning worked well. Beds were very comfortable and there were three tvs (one in each bedroom and one in the living room) which could be used with Netflix, Prime, YouTube, etc

Breakfast was really enjoyable. Buffet style but also had an egg station with delicious omelettes. There was also a rotating menu of Vietnamese local noodles. If you get a chance, the local My Quang chicken noodle soup is delicious. Breakfast runs from 6:30 to 10:30 and you won't go hungry. Tons of variety and fresh juices (passionfruit, mango, watermelon, etc.) along with Vietnamese coffee, normal coffee, tea.. whatever you need.

The gym was basic but very clean and well maintained. The view from the gym was even better than the hotel room. First day the AC was off inside but after pointing this out, they promptly addressed it.

The swimming pool was a tad busy but very comfortable and had great service. The pool towels smelled extremely fresh which was nice.

Location is decent. Directly across from the beach. Lots of seafood restaurants down the street. Also a convenience store about 200m away walking distance.

That said, the prices are inflated - if you use Grab, take a 5 min ride down the road to Vincom Plaza (big mall) and go to the grocery store called Winmart where you will find much cheaper goods. Likely useful for longer stays or those who want to cook.
Negative_Review:
As others have mentioned, the elevators could be a bit frustrating and slow depending on the time of day. Only felt the AC on in them once for the three nights we stayed. I think part of the issue is the size of the property but also the fact that there are no separate service elevators. We rode with staff multiple times. Must be extremely frustrating for them and likely leads to problems with efficiency. 

However, this was a very minor inconvenience. The elevators were always clean and we're equipped with air freshener units. If you are staying on the 27th floor or higher, would recommend using the stairs to access the gym facilities and breakfast in the morning (if you are physically able).

The only other suggestion would be to bring an extension cord or a multi plug extender as there was only one outlet on each side of the bed in the bedroom. 

Finally, the bath towels did smell a bit musty but in my experience that is hard to avoid in seaside accommodations. If I am mistaken and there is a way to mitigate this, this would be my primary suggestion for Altara on easily achievable improvements.
Review_Title: Outstanding Service and Well Maintained Property
HotelName: Altara Suites Da Nang by AHG

Positive_Review: Das Appartement war fÃ¼r unsere 4-kÃ¶pfige Familie mehr als groÃŸ genug. Es war bis auf ein paar Kleinigkeiten alles vorhanden, was wir benÃ¶tigt haben. Wir konnten in dem Appartement selbst kochen, da unsere Kindern mit dem vietnamesischen Essen nicht so gut zurecht kamen. Auch eine Waschmaschine und ein WÃ¤schetrockner waren enthalten. Einen kleinen Balkon vor dem hinteren Schlafzimmer gab es auch, allerdings wurde mehr als die HÃ¤lfte der FlÃ¤che davon vom AuÃŸengerÃ¤t der Klimaanlage in Anspruch genommen. Der Zimmerservice reinigte das Appartement inklusive der KÃ¼che jeden Tag. Unsere Kinder haben den kleinen Pool auf der Dachterrasse mit einer wunderschÃ¶nen Aussicht geliebt. Das Personal war meist freundlich und hilfsbereit. Hervorzuheben sind die Mitarbeiter/innen im Hotelrestaurant, die sehr aufmerksam waren (Duyen, Hung etc). Insgesamt waren wir 8 Tage in dem Appartement.
Negative_Review: Da der Rezeptionsbereich ziemlich klein war, war es nicht so angenehm, sich dort lÃ¤nger aufzuhalten. Auch die Toilette neben der Rezeption kÃ¶nnte sauberer sein, um den Anspruch eines gehobenen Aparthotels gerecht zu werden. Die Besetzung an der Rezeption war nicht optimal, mal standen dort 4-5 Mitarbeiter/innen herum, die wenig zu tun hatten und mal war es nur von einer Person besetzt, als auf ein Mal viele GÃ¤ste ankamen. Oft haben wir zu lange auf den Fahrstuhl warten mÃ¼ssen, da es nur 3 FahrstÃ¼hle im ganzen Building mit 39 (?) Stockwerken gibt. Der Buffetaufbau im Restaurants kann definitiv besser organisiert werden. StÃ¤ndiges DrÃ¤ngeln am Buffet war absolut unnÃ¶tig, auch weil manche GÃ¤ste nicht wussten, wo das Ende einer Warteschlange war. Das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksangebot fÃ¼r Kinder war leider sehr dÃ¼rftig. Unsere Kinder im Alter von 6 und 12 J. kamen sich im FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksrestaurant verloren vor, weil die Speisen fast nur fÃ¼r Erwachsene ausgerichtet waren. Vielleicht wÃ¼rde die Einrichtung eines "Kid corner" im FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksrestaurant den Service aufwerten. Die Ausstattung der KÃ¼chenutensilien kann auch verbessert werden. Was uns auffiel, war, dass wir nirgendswo in den insgesamt 5 Appartements, in den wir auf unserer Vietnam-Reise aufgehalten haben, ein Schneidebrett gefunden haben. Trotz allem wÃ¼rde wir gerne dieses Aparthotel wieder buchen, falls wir wieder nach Da Nang kommen.
Review_Title: Erholsame Tage in einem strandnahen, guten Aparthotel

Positive_Review: To me Danang has Two Main Areas. The beachfront and The River View. Novotel Location is ideal For the Danang River view experience. The customer Service by all the Staff was Exceptional. The Room was Spacious and the Balcony offered a view of the city the river and the ocean. A true panoramic View We enjoyed during our Stay. The bed was Very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was very clean and Spacious. The breakfast buffet was very good. Large selection for all tastes. The gym was very good. The Pool was large clean and beautiful with a great view. During our Stay we went to Ba Na Hills. If one of your main Activities in Da nang is to go to Ba Na hills than i highly recommend you Stay at novotel as they are able to offer purchase your tickets for the Sun world Park and also offer special Deals that you cannot get anywhere else. my Booking included the lounge access and Giang from the executive lounge Staff went above and beyond my expectations when it came to our complete experience at Novotel. Giang helped book our entire day At Sunworld and made sure that we were able to enjoy the perfect Trip to Sunworld.

Positive_Review: We had booked a corner suite which was really spacious and comfortable. We were looking forward to staying in that room, but the noise from a discotheque next door was so deafening (bass) that we had to move room. The staff was very helpful and understanding and I kind of felt sorry for them. Breakfast on the club floor was very pleasant, nice staff there, too. The hotel also helped us to organize a trip to Hoi An. It is really a nice hotel and a great location along the river, if it wasn't for the discotheque.
Negative_Review: The noise of the discotheque next door is beyond any acceptable level. The bass noise is deafening and it is really impossible to sleep. We had moved from the corner suite to a much smaller room on the other side, but the noise was only slightly less. Apparently, the manager had contacted the police one evening - they came by and found the noise level acceptable.... I cannot understand how the city allows a business in the central hotel district to be so noisy without anybody stopping it. I think Novotel will need to have a serious word with the city counsel about this or they will lose customers.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe á» GÃ³c CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King KÃ¨m Ban CÃ´ng VÃ  Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra ToÃ n Cáº£nh SÃ´ng HÃ n
Positive_Review: The view from our room
Negative_Review: The staff were really helpful and we had the most phenomenal views from the corner suite. We booked this hotel as a one off for my birthday and the room and facilities did not disappoint. The swimming pool and view is beautiful and they have a restaurant on the same floor. For lunch we had some great food and the price is as expected a little more than you would normally pay in Vietnam. For our evening meal the menu was the same however they do advertise a sea food BBQ and Al a carte Menu but this was not given to us as an option and the bottle of wine we chose was not available. We were the only ones who dined during this time and the restaurant was completely empty. There is a lift to the sky bar from the hotel, this is not the same company as the hotel, but they do promote it, so we chose to have a drink there for the experience. The cocktails were triple the price (350,000 dong +) and they were handing out wet towels as you sat there and then charged you for them on the bill. This ruined our hotel experience. Overall it was a nice and different experience but I think I will stick to the cheaper hotels in future.

Positive_Review:
Breakfast variety was awesome and tasty. Love their herbal tea. Artsy design, very beautiful and full of nature. Bicycles provided though we didn't use. 
Special shout out to Thien Nanh and Vanh for great service throughout our stay! Also the lady at the front desk who helped find a clinic when I was sick.
Herbal wine was provided in the room which is rather unique
Negative_Review:
Bathroom could have some railings for the towels.
Safe deposit box would be better if secured at the base.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE NATURE GREEN
Positive_Review: Close to the beach! Very nice hotel
Negative_Review: There was a miscommunication between the staff regarding the payment of our stay - so we almost ended up playing twice. Also there was a slight language barrier (their english wasnâ€™t the best), whenever we ordered breakfast or had questions about the room.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review:
The staff was very friendly, all of them actually, I could mention every body but I only know the receptionist's name, Mr. Thien Nhan.
Anyway, a great experience. The breakfast is also really good, it worth it a lot.
Negative_Review: The hotel is well located and they have bike available for the guests but it is not right in front of the sea, even if it is closed to it.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE NATURE GREEN
Positive_Review:
This newly opened hotel boasts impeccably maintained facilities and friendly and enthusiastic staff. The hotel's stunning design, both in its architecture and interior, further enhanced our experience. It was truly an unforgettable stay. The hotel was close to the beach, and it was very convenient to walk there. 

Our late arrival due to a delayed flight was handled with exceptional care, and the hotel proactively arranged airport pick-up services, exceeding our expectations.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review: Fabulous accomodation. Friendly staff, large spacious rooms, the hotelâ€™s architecture is beautiful and very close to the beach. The rooftop pool is fabulous however it wasnâ€™t very refreshing when we were there.
Negative_Review: The hotel is a little far from the action in Da Nanag. We borrowed bikes to get to the beach and used Grab to get around. Easy and convenient.
Review_Title: Absolutely beautiful hotel with lovely staff and fabulous room.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review: Modern design, cozy and friendly staff
Negative_Review: Nil
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review: Staff were super friendly, lovely room - really spacious. Very convenient to walk to the beach, supermarket.
Negative_Review: Breakfast was ok - it would have been nice to have a bit more selection of fruit/cereal/juice/coffee for "help yourself" rather than only having either coffee or juice. Maybe a selection of breads too. However, you could choose your main breakfast each day and it was always freshly cooked.
Review_Title: Amazing value, really large room and very friendly staff.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review: "I stayed here for five days and truly felt at home. The service was amazing, and they made me feel so welcome. The hotel is conveniently located near many nice and fancy restaurants, as well as street food options. It's less than a 10-minute walk to the beach. The hotel's architecture is also very beautiful."
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel was my favourite stay in Vietnam. The staff is so lovely and helpful, the breakfast is very good and the location is fantastic. Itâ€™s a new hotel so the rooms and the facilities are immaculate. Itâ€™s a little green oasis in a beautiful city ğŸ˜Š
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: SUITE GARDEN BALCONY BATHTUB
Positive_Review:
The place is very new, in a quiet street which we liked
A bit of an enclave away from the high rises 
A few good restaurants nearby
Staff tried their very best to look after us but there was a lot of confusion due to a lack of English understood
Negative_Review:
The TV was a pain as all instructions are in Vietnamese
Staff helped me connect to Netflix and YouTube so we survived on that
The breakfast was unusual but included
You order the day before
Iâ€™d suggest the local dishes 
Decent coffee machine helped when driven properly
Breakfast is served in the back of the lobby which was a little steamy at times
Pool water was cloudy and inviting
Review_Title: Lovely suite, great aircon, Iâ€™m sure with time this will be a special place to stay once they get more organised and exp
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: GRAND SUITE GARDEN BALCONY BATHTUB
Positive_Review:
This may be the prettiest hotel I've ever stayed at; every single corner of our room looks amazing, we even took notes and inspiration for an upcoming house renovation lol.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful; their english is not the best but if you speak slowly they can hold a conversation. I love that you can borrow the umbrellas and bicycles for free, perfect to cycle down to the beach which is just down the road. The staff will also happily give you food recommendations and point out which spots are touristy and which are the local ones.

This may be unconventional, but my favourite thing about Saha Casa is actually the breakfast! You won't get a continental-style breakfast buffet (though I think they have sausages and eggs as one of the breakfast options) but a slim selection of porridge / chicken soup / noodles made with ginseng (a type of herb). I grew up in an oriental household and this reminded me of the time my grandmother stayed with us and made us breakfasts everyday. Extremely wholesome and nourishing! They would also happily bring your breakfast to your room for you if you request.

PS: Do yourself a favour and check out The Whale, which is a small cocktail bar just next door. I had one of the BEST cocktails I've ever had in my life there. Literally just next door, so you can let yourself get a little tipsy ;)
Negative_Review:
(This is NOT a reflection of shortcomings of the hotel, but merely some notes to the management for improvement)
- I wish there was a full length mirror in the room.
- We could have used some cutleries too.
- The blinds in the bathroom don't 'stick' closely to the glass window, meaning that people outside can look inside towards the shower and the tub, especially if the lights are on at night... It's such a shame because the bath was beautiful; we ended up buying some tape to tape it down temporarily. I recommend getting the windows treated with privacy tint.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review: The hotel is so clean and new. The rooms are spacious and beautiful throughout. We had an amazing stay and the staff made it even better. Everyone is so lovely and kind - helped us with everything.
Negative_Review: There are so many nice breakfast coffee shop places nearby that we didn't try the breakfast. So can't comment on it but looked alright.
Review_Title: Amazing stay at this new hotel near My Khe beach
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review: the hotel is extremely BEAUTIFUL, and located very near the beach. the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the pool is also built well, since it is of even depth throughout and so, safe for kids. the breakfast is pre-order so you get to choose what to get and all the options are very health-themed and portions are filling.
Negative_Review: the hotel is very short-staffed and there were only two people rushing to cater to everyone. the breakfast options were limited to 3 and the common options like omelettes, toast, fruit were missing. the bidets in the toilets were not usable.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review: It was very clean and the rooms were absolutely beautiful! The staff went super kind and accommodating and the free breakfast was also delicious. I will recommend this very unique hotel to my friends.
Negative_Review: Nothing :)
Review_Title: A beautiful and unique hotel with helpful staff.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE NATURE GREEN
Positive_Review: Beautiful, new, funky hotel. Very comfortable. Good location. Fabulous pool. Appreciated the early check in. Nice to chat with the owner, his English is really good, and he is very personable. When we were seated in the lobby, there were a few enquires about this property from off the street as it does look quite spectacular. Thanks for the complimentary wine :)
Negative_Review: Improvements (not complaints) - Breakfast needs improving for western options. Was a misunderstanding with the receptionist about a courier charge that wasnâ€™t mine at the end of the stay, which kind of took away from how relaxed I was feeling prior to check out. The elevator bell is quite loud and frequent from the room we stayed in. Not sure if it is chiming even when itâ€™s arriving at another level.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: SUITE GARDEN BALCONY BATHTUB
Positive_Review:
the design of the hotel is too cute and special, very instagrammable, while the white tone of the room is soothing and comfortable. i can find everything i need for the stay provided.

breakfast is simple, but there are so many nice restaurants around the neighborhood within walking distance.

beach is just 10 mins walk away, and it's a very beautiful beach with happy people.

i must express my big thanks to Thian, the front desk supervisor, she was kind and very helpful, makes my stay easy and comfortable, a memorable stay.
Review_Title: a calm and cosy boutique hotel close to a lovely beach.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review: Beautiful boutique hotel with rooftop pool, nice design, great herbal tea and lovely Mi Quang (and other options) for breakfast. But the best part was the incredible staff! Everyone was so kind and helpful during our stay. Uyen and Trinh both gave us great recommendations on local foods and what to see and do, and the breakfast and bar staff were so sweet as well, always checking if we needed anything. We were very sad to leave!
Negative_Review: Nothing
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: With modern architecture and meticulous care to every detail, the space of Saha Casa hotel really impressed my husband and me, especially the breakfast here is made from herbs and is very good for health. In addition, Saha Casa staff is very professional and helped us a lot
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Trinh was so nicee, everyone was so kind. Place was beautiful
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Room service at the hotel is very professional and attentive. I always feel satisfied with the way they care and handle all my requests. Staff at the hotel are always happy to provide information and suggestions about surrounding activities and attractions. I had a great travel experience thanks to their support
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Breakfast at the restaurant is diverse and different from other hotels. And the food provided is healthy because it comes from herbs. In addition, I really like the two glasses of herbal wine in the room. They smell delicious and create a relaxing atmosphere when I return to the hotel after a day out.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Saha Casa is like a herb garden. It is known that the owners here invest in healthy foods. Saha Casa's story has inspired a lot about nature. In particular, I really liked the two glasses of herbal wine in the room and the breakfast here
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review: Very nice rooms and lovely, helpful staff. Especially want to thank Uyen at reception and the other staff member who assisted me went I was feeling ill.
Review_Title: We would recommend staying at Saha Casa .
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: Saha Casa is like an herb garden. I know that the owner here invests in healthy food. Saha Casa's story has inspired me a lot about nature. In particular, I really liked the two glasses of herbal wine in the room and the breakfast here gave me the most different experience compared to other hotels I've been to.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: PREMIER GARDEN BALCONY
Positive_Review: Pretty good location close to the beach, well decorated, perfectly clean, very nice staff, good breakfast.
Negative_Review: No bar or snacking options at the pool
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE SAND BEACH
Positive_Review:
It is so beautifull!! All the plants, makes you feel like you are in nature instead of being in a busy city.

We really loved having a coffee in front of our room, between the calmness and relax a little after being to the beach (which is very close).

The rooms are big, huge bed and it looks all very nice. Love the design and every little detail is looked after.
Negative_Review: Nothing!! Go and see it yourself :)
Review_Title: Calm and relaxing, love all the nature
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: SUITE GARDEN BALCONY BATHTUB
Positive_Review: We had the best stay at this hotel. Brand new hotel, high spec with spacious and comfy rooms. Staff were really trustworthy, very friendly and incredibly helpful. Would highly recommend taking the free bikes out and cycling up and down the beach!
Negative_Review: Breakfast could be improved by adding simple things like cereal, yoghurt and toasting the bread and the quality of the bread.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: I am very satisfied with the service at this hotel. Friendly and enthusiastic staff, always willing to help and meet all guests' requests. In particular, I like the two glasses of herbal wine in the room the most, the drink is strange and brings the most pleasant feeling I have ever drunk.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

Positive_Review: Perfectly located on a side street which means itâ€™s very quiet and away from the loud parties on the beach. Beautiful architecture, delicious breakfast and very serene. Truly an oasis.

HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

Negative_Review: Nothing

HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

Positive_Review:
Very nice desigend new hotel, professional and very helpful stuff.
Strongly recommend place, it's a real insider tip.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE NATURE GREEN
Positive_Review: My stay at Saha Casa was exceptional. I loved every bit of it. The hotel staff are incredibly nice and will go above and beyond to help you. I went on a solo trip but felt soooo taken care of by the staff, I was very touched. The hotel itself is beautiful and looks like a tropical oasis next to the other building in the area. The room is beautifully decorated and is spacious, yet very cozy. The breakfast menu is incredible, I only tried the Vietnamese options and the food was really healthy, yummy, and filling. I also really like the herbal tea that they serve at the hotel. Loved my stay at Saha Casa and would definitely recommend it to all my friends planning to visit Da Nang.
Review_Title: A beautiful place for rest and relaxation
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: The hotel is new so everything looks very clean and airy. This place makes me feel like I want to immerse myself in nature. The amenities and services included here are very special. What impressed me most was probably 2 glasses of herbal wine from Saha Casa. I will come back here if I have the chance. Thank you!
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: The family room I stayed in had a fully equipped kitchen. It was convenient for me to cook milk for the baby when I had young children. It was clean, the swimming pool was safe, and it was near a seafood restaurant right on the beach. In addition, I really like the service and staff here, everyone has served our family very thoughtfully.
Review_Title: A retreat corner in Danang city
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: The bedroom is spacious, airy, looks very vintage and is fully equipped with amenities, helping me feel comfortable and relaxed. The hotel's common space is also very beautiful, and the staff is friendly and enthusiastic. I will return to Saha Casa if I have the opportunity to come to Vietnam.
HotelName: Saha Casa Boutique Hotel Da Nang

RoomType: DELUXE OCEAN BLUE
Positive_Review: With modern architecture and meticulous care to every detail, the space of Saha Casa hotel really impressed my husband and me, feeling comfortable and wonderful.

Positive_Review:
Room size was comfortable for two people even stay for several days. Big windows, panorama ocean view, east-facing, watch the sun rise at room, very nice. 

Room was new, neat and tidy. Sufficient lighting in room during night time. LED TV was good size among other hotels. I love their tile floors, no carpet at all.

All staff were in good manners, including the bell boys, front desk, house-keepers, restaurants staffs etc.

The Vietnam coffee provided in the buffet breakfast was nice, donâ€™t miss it. Tried their free tea buffet once and itâ€™s nice too. Tried their body massage, professional. 

The pool was not big but the view was very good. 

A convenient store located 5 mins walk at the RHS of the hotel. The beautiful beach just crosses the road.
Negative_Review:
Working desk was too small, as the room has lot of space left. 

The fridge was a joke. After we told the house-keeping that our fridge was not cool enough, they sent a technical man very quickly for investigation. The technical man used a thermometer to test the temperature of the fridge. Then told us the temperature was normal, no problem. We said no, our beverage and fruits put inside were totally not cold enough. He said because it was not a â€œfridgeâ€, itâ€™s a â€œcoolerâ€. He just tested itâ€™s temperature was between 10-15C, so itâ€™s in normal operation. As he was in good manner; we didnâ€™t want to blame him. Just could not imagine the days we stayed there was around 33-34C in the day time, but the hotel is not providing a fridge but just a â€œcoolerâ€.
Review_Title: Good ocean view, new and tidy room

Positive_Review:
Great interior Design, great facilities, staff was very friendly. Checking in earlier or even checking out later (with a little extra fee if you stay after 12:30) is possible if the capacity allows it. Which was great as our flight out of town was due in the evening. 
The beach is just across the street. The views from the hotel pool towards the sea are stunning. They have a nice gym room in the top floor with nice views towards the ocean and peninsula. 
The breakfast is amongst the most diverse I have come across in Vietnam. 
Definitely recommend staying here!

The hotel staff were all so friendly and helpful. A special thankyou to Hanh and Ngoc who worked in the Spa who were especially helpful. I also had a massage at the spa, thank you Ms Yee who did a great Job. The staff at the restraunt were always happy to help and were very welcoming at all times. The room was very clean and fresh and the furnishings were to a very high standard. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and always looked forward coming back to the hotel to relax! 
I would highly recommend this Hotel! I would definitely be going back again!

Positive_Review:
The hotel's location was truly fantastic, situated right on the beach and offering easy access to the sparkling waters and golden sands. I was blown away by the stunning ocean view that greeted me as I stepped into my room. Seeing the sunrise each morning was magical.
The service at this hotel was exceptional, with the staff going above and beyond to ensure that my every need was met. From the friendly check-in process to the attentive housekeeping staff, everyone I encountered was dedicated to providing the highest level of service.
The rooms themselves were well appointed and comfortable. The bed was incredibly plush and luxurious, providing the perfect night's sleep after a long active day. The view from my room was truly breathtaking, with sweeping vistas of the ocean that were simply unforgettable.
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. With its fantastic location, excellent service, well appointed rooms, and stunning views, it truly is a gem in Danang.

Positive_Review:
beachfront. impressive as soon as we arrive staff came to assist with luggage from the bus . welcome drink and wet washcloth to refresh. 

rooms are very clean and spacious we stayed at a junior suite ocean view. can hear the waves if windows are open and so relaxing to watch the waves 

bathroom is very clean and toilet has bidet and rain shower and has everything you need

dining room has ocean view and city view good variety of Asian and continental food, Vietnamese coffee . really worth it for the price we paid.
 infinity pool was nice overlooking the ocean. it was windy at the time we were about to swim so just took picture
sky bar was awesome
location was near alot of seafood restaurant very affordable prices and very clean. the hotel has a restaurant right next to it. very convenient
shopping at Hahn market was only about 2 miles away. (taxi at $3-4)
staff was awesome . very attentive to our needs. very honest and hardworking people.

we will definitely recommend this place to friends and families and we would like to come back with our family.

Positive_Review:
The property is neat and clean . The rooms are big. The bed is nice and soft. We slept well. Towels are neat and fresh. Although the toiletries are very average. 
The pool is nice. The High tea was great. We were given many options as vegetarians.
Negative_Review: The Breakfast for Vegetarians is HARDLY ANYTHING. Usually all hotels offer Services to make something immediately for their Vegetarian guests if the menu doesn't have options, but This hotel had no interest in helping. They denied that anything could be made. We just got a fruit plate for Breakfast. Very sad experience early in the morning at a hotel of this rating. We were disappointed.
Review_Title: NOT THE BEST AT THIS PRICE.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe Golden Bay CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King Vá»›i Ban CÃ´ng VÃ  Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Vá»‹nh
Positive_Review: The staff at reception were very helpful at check in and check out. The room was tired looking but clean. They also allowed us to check in a hour earlier which was really helpful as we needed to get ready for the event. There was no turn down service but I think they were just too busy.
Negative_Review:
Although the staff were helpful and tied their best it was way too busy and the hotel wasnâ€™t equipped to deal with the tour group visitors and the foreigners coming for a major event. 
Breakfast was hectic. People pushing past you to get to the food. Tables jammed in too close to each other. It wasnâ€™t peaceful at all. They had huge Asian tour groups so the food was catered to them mostly. No egg station for omelettes. Eggs were already fried and stacked in a pile so they were stone cold when you tried to eat. No fresh coffee which was the worst. Only Vietnamese coffee or instant powdered coffee. I wouldnâ€™t recommend going down early for it. Huge lines for lifts to get to and from the rooms. 
They advertise an amazing roof top bar but literally only day we stayed due to the event on the US carrier and couldnâ€™t get a quiet drink at the bar because they close it on Mondays!! I think given the event they could have considered keeping it open.
Review_Title: It was ok for a work trip and convenient for the meeting place but I wonâ€™t be back in a hurry.

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Deluxe Golden Bay CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King Vá»›i Ban CÃ´ng VÃ  Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Vá»‹nh
Positive_Review: The only thing they're good at is photoshop. The photos of the facilities are a lie, especially the pool. The room was good, but that was the only positive. The restaurant on 1st floor almost sent my husband to the hospital. I informed them of his allergy and stomach sickness, and asked 5 times for a not spicy meal beforehand. They brought a flaming-red, most spicy ramen we've ever tried (which wasn't indicated in the menu), and instead of apologizing, they defended stubbornly and just changed the water of the soup, but kept the rest and the chilies on top, which was still very spicy. We were forced to pay, even though we almost had to go BACK to the hospital because of this "mistake". Anyone can make a mistake, but amend after, and the whole staff did the opposite. The restaurant on the rooftop was ok though, and informed about my husband's state.
Negative_Review: The hotel feels like a post-apocalyptic, post-communist war, ghost motel. We felt a really creepy vibe, especially in the pool (which is the reason most people go). Everything is rusted, old. The sun loungers are dirty and the towels have holes in them. The casino tv's in the lifts are super annoying. The staff is also incapable, they forgot one of our 2 big suitcases in the room when checking out, and defended themselves not believing there was another one, I was forced to go with to prove them.
Review_Title: Horrible ghost hotel, one of the worst! NOT recommended at all! Incompetent staff, creepy facilities

RoomType: Deluxe Queen Room - High floor with Privilege Lounge access
Positive_Review: Our family had access to the Club Lounge, which we used for breakfast on one morning and joined the Happy Hour (including dinner) every night. The staff throughout the hotel are amazing, specially in the Club Lounge and the dining room. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The walk-in shower was much appreciated, as we had combined tubs/showers in the other three hotels that we stayed in. The food in the ground floor restaurant was amazing.
Negative_Review: The location of the swimming pool is a disaster. It is in full view of both a side road with pedestrians and traffic and the hotel reception foyer. There is absolutely no privacy for swimmers. Also,there is a drain running almost alongside the pool, and the odour from the drain does not make for an enjoyable experience for swimmers. We mentioned this to the hotel General Manager, and he undertook to investigate this matter.
Review_Title: Beautiful luxurious hotel, with fabulous facilities (except for the swimming pool).

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior coÌ giÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng cÆ¡Ìƒ Queen NhÃ¬n ra SÃ´ng
Positive_Review: The room was clean and comfortable with a spectacular view over the river. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Lan in the priority lounge was exceptional even helping a parent distract an over wrought screaming child to calm down. The breakfast was excellent. We stayed overnight but wished we had stayed longer. The location was set back away from traffic on a little island on the river with restaurants close by. We met the general manager who came over and chatted to guests which was a nice touch. They did have shuttles to locations in danang. Best run hotel we had stayed in the last two months away.

RoomType: Executive Suite with River View - High floor with Privilege Lounge access
Positive_Review: The staff were incredibly friendly and more than willing to help. The reception staff even took the time to sit and chat while I was waiting for one of my Grab taxis. My room was big enough and had a walk-in wardrobe and an area to store my suitcase out of the way. The executive lounge was big and spacious and overlooked the river and amusement park. Check-in and out were quick and easy.
Negative_Review: The wifi in my room kept dropping out. One of the lights in my room was faulty. However, this was of no concern to me. I had two television screens in my room. When I turned the one in the bedroom on, the one in the living area would turn on

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior coÌ giÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng cÆ¡Ìƒ Queen NhÃ¬n ra SÃ´ng
Positive_Review: Very friendly staff with good English in the lobby (less so in the restaurants). A comfortable, newly furnished room with a very good mattress and strong A/C helped. Cable TV was fine. Wi-Fi was strong. The breakfast spread is grand and very good. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby evenings and having a drink while people watching. (No one else did this, so we had personal bar service.) The GM wandered around the lobby and personally helped guests: quite an unusual touch.
Negative_Review: The location is about 1 km away from anything touristy (e.g. wet markets, restaurants) in a quiet area outside the city center. (This really wasn't a big deal as we enjoy walking and cabs are abundant and cheap.) The Vietnamese dishes in the coffeeshop were mediocre other than the excellent spring rolls (in all varieties).
Review_Title: Very nice base for a Danang Visit

RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior coÌ giÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng cÆ¡Ìƒ Queen NhÃ¬n ra SÃ´ng
Positive_Review:
1. The hotel location is good; as from the hotel room, you are able to see the entire night view vividly, eg, the dragon bridge and etc. 
2. The hotel provides free shuttle bus to a couple of places free of charge.
3. The hotel environment and facilities are inviting; the lobby is very spacious, and there is plenty of room to roam about. 
4. It is value for money. It is very affordable for such a 4 star rating hotel.
Negative_Review:
1. The shower room has no door. It's hard to bathe without splashing some water outside. Water control is kinda out of control: hot and cold hard to navigate.
2. The shower area is visible from outside despite pulling down the blinder. Kinda translucent.
3. The bath toiletries are very limited for 2 pax; too small qty provided.
4. Breakfast spread is limited, almost similar food every other day; not much variety as well.
5. Staff is not as responsive and attentive enough for a 4-star rating hotel.

CustomerNational: United Arab Emirates (CaÌc TiÃªÌ‰u VÆ°Æ¡ng QuÃ´Ìc AÌ‰ RÃ¢Ì£p ThÃ´Ìng NhÃ¢Ìt)
RoomType: PhÃ²ng Superior cÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng cá»¡ Queen vÃ  NhÃ¬n ra ThÃ nh phá»‘
Positive_Review:
- Extremely close to the airport, which is the reason why we booked here, since we had an early flight to Phu Quoc after our stay at Danang, it took us only 6 minutes to arrive at the airport.

- The room looks better than the photos. Satisfyingly clean. Bathroom has a modern design. Nothing exceptional but it felt very comfortable.

- We were given upon check-in a voucher for 2 complimentary welcome drinks at the bar, though we did not find the time to use it, it was a nice touch.
Negative_Review:
- Some staff were extremely petty and rude. We were staying only for 2 nights so we did not bother to have housekeeping clean our room. Instead, we called front desk in the late afternoon and asked only to replace the water (2 per room per night) and the petite little bottle of hair conditioner that we finished. The front desk staff at the phone only agreed to replace the water after what sounded to me like a rude interrogation with an unpleasant tone. ("We gave you water", "There is already water". "Did you see the 2 water by the sink?", "Did you finish the water?" and finally "Okay, I will mark down that we give you your 2 FREE water for today.") Which was already shocking to me, but she doubled down with telling me we can only get 1 bottle of hair conditioner for 1 room and refused to give me a new one or a refill. Is that the official policy of an international 5-star hotel? I have stayed in plenty of similar hotels all over the world and I have never heard of that before.

- Food from the breakfast was subpar. Most things were either too salty or tasteless. The whole fruits (Vietnamese apples, rose apples) were either rotting or rotten when you cut them open. Pre-sliced fruits were fine though.

- If you have a noisy neighbour in the connecting room, it can ruin your night of sleep. The Korean couple that stayed next to us had a big argument during one night of our stay and woke us up a few times.

- No one offered to show us our room or help us with our luggages when we checked in, even when the hotel staff did not look busy when we arrived. We are 2 grown adults who are perfectly capable of doing so ourselves but were very surprised it was not offered. We also had to ask when and where breakfast would be served since no one mentioned anything at check in.
Review_Title: Clean Comfortable Hotel close to the Airport, with Unprofessional Staff and Poor Breakfast

Positive_Review: Was a nice older building in good condition still but like a 70's style casino hotel. Nice spacious room on high floor with a great view. Breakfast was excellent with great staff. It was close to the nite markets, good Vietnamese local restuarants and the Champ museum. Best highlight of the trip along with My Son. Beaches were lovely but winter n rainy season. Like all Vietnam no sidewalks for pedestrians to walk and treacherous with rain on terrazo tiles everywhere.
Negative_Review: Xmas was disappointing at hotel but staff were lovely. They were quick to charge our card for the room full payment for the stay before we arrived and refused to refund n put on another card and insisted on a refund charge. Hotel in Saigon did the same early charging full payment but they refunded with no charge and let us use another card to pay with no issues!
